comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2019
comment_title: This is very dangerous product ! Do not buy !
comment: I've been buying this product for a year, I bought it many times and I would definetely give it 5 start, but...  today when I was enjoying it something very sharp stack deep inside of my tongue.It was piece of very thin still wire of about 0.4 inch of length. It was definitely inside of the seaweed sheet. At first I thought that it is a fish bone in ut it was wire. I'm scared to death now. I was not expecting this to happen. This thing is very very dangerous. I hardly can image what could have happened if I swallowed it. Also I was used to give it to my kids...DO NOT BUY, THIS IS VERY DANGEROUS PRODUCT !!!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2018
comment: Thsee don't expire until December. I opened this up today and found what looks like bug eggs. Disgusting. I'm going to have to throw out all the rest now. This was sealed still too so the bug must've got in during initial packaging.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2018
comment: The photo shows the seaweed brands I've tried in order of preference.Jayone: crisp and lightly salted. Delicious at a bargain price. These are great with a meal or just to satisfy those evening cravings. I also cut them up and take them to the theatre in place of popcorn. These are a tiny bit saltier than the gimMe brand.gimMe: very similar if not quite as salty as the Jayone, just a little more expensive and slightly more oil. They seem to flake a little more than the Jayone, but are still very good. I do like having the option to buy 10g trays or 5g trays for taking along as a snack or addition to a meal.Black Label Gourmet: driest and least salty of the bunch, but still a nice crunch. A little different flavor because they're roasted with olive oil instead of sesame or sunflower. They taste a little less sea-like and a little more earthy. These are the ones I like to use to roll salmon or tuna.Wickedly Prime: I can't recommend these at all. Though they supposedly have less salt than a couple of the other brands, they are terribly greasy and taste so salty I couldn't eat them; neither could my family. The only thing I can think to do with them is rinse them and re-roast them to see if they improve. Definitely not worth buying.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2017
comment: The first time I bought these I fell in love.. out of all 10 types of seaweed snacks I have tried, these were the best. The difference was that the first time I ordered through Amazon fresh, not this time, so I'm sure the seller is different. Well, these seaweed snacks are horrible. Oily, the flavor is awful, and stake. Check the pictures out where the oil is dripping inside the packaging.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2017
comment_title: The BEST seasoned seaweed makers in the WORLD
comment: I ate the entire box in a week. This stuff is DELICIOUS. If you enjoy traditional Korean seaweed, this is it, folks. I've tried several American made brands and they all use WAY too much oil or the seaweed is too thick. This seaweed is perfectly thin and crumbly, salted and lightly seasoned with oils. The pouches arrived the original 24 pack box that was inside an amazon box. I appreciated the Amazon box as I don't want someone to see I have delicious seaweed and decide to take it. I felt like the snack packs had a generous amount of seaweed in them, compared to other snack packs I've tried. One pouch would definitely be great for a rice bowl, udon or just in between classes. Mmm so good.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2017
comment_title: This batch smelled and tasted like gasoline.
comment: This batch smelled and tasted like gasoline...very bizarre.  My kids sniffed it and would not touch it, and I tasted a piece to confirm the packs were "off".  Disgusting.  Threw out the whole box

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2016
comment_title: A lot of seaweed for the price!
comment: I bought this seaweed as a snack food not for sushi, so I can't answer any questions or have any input towards it's position in sushi or rice. I eat it like I'd eat potato chips.I don't think I understood how much seaweed I was getting for the price. I've neever had seaweed and I've never bought it in person so I had no expectations. The massive box showed up filled with a ton of snack pack sized seaweed crisps. My initial taste test of it was not great since I didn't like it too much but it eventually grew on me. If you're new to it or you're feeding it to kids, it takes a couple of tries to know if you like it or not. The packages are easy to open, just tear them like any other snacckfood, and take out the little tray full of sheets.The sheets are a little greasy from whatever processing happens, this isn't an issue at all but I figured I'd mention it. A friend of mine that eats similar products more reguarly figured they needed more salt but they are clearly labeled "Lightly salted". Avoid the moisture absorber at the bottom of each pack and you're good to go. This tasty snack will stick in your teeth and affect breath so rinsing your mouth out after eating would be advisable.Pros: Tons of seaweed for the price, Good quality and healthy snack, easy to open.Cons: Slightly greasy, can affect breath/teeth

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2017
comment_title: Good size snack and very healthy.
comment: As someone who has never tried seaweed before these took a minute to get used to. They are thin sheets of dried seaweed in a little plastic tray, in single serving packs. There's a bit of a waste of packaging but I guess there isn't another way to do it without breaking them up. They are kind of fragile. The serving size is generous and very few calories. I got used to the taste by the 2nd or 3rd sheet. It's a little spinachy, that's probably the closest thing I can think of in taste. Not strong though. They aren't terribly filling but they take some time to eat and make for a good snack.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
comment: I was okay with this product, the taste was fine, etc., but I wasn't okay when I found a big black hair in the seaweed package.  With this in mind, I threw-out nearly an entire order (box) of seaweed in the trash.  Obviously this company doesn't adhere to it's sanitation procedures or rules.  That is disgusting!!!  I forgot to take a picture of that as I was disgusted out of my mind when I found it.  Will look elsewhere for a seaweed product.  Would not recommend.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2017
comment: I am a fan of seaweed snacks and have tried many. This package was okay in terms of overall quality.It is lightly salted as described for those looking to lessen their salt intake. The portions could be bigger because after you're done with a pack you still want more. The texture is really flat (I'm used to bumps and shapes), so it feels like eating flat salted sea chips.This wasn't good enough for me to buy again, but for those looking for a less salty version of a seaweed snack, it may be for you.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020
comment_title: Most expensive bag of chips ever.
comment: Delicious, but who would pay $16 for a bag of chips, really? I thought I was getting a case for that price!

comment: I love these chips but feel ripped off as I thought BULk meant several bags. This out landing price resulted in just 1 bag.

comment: These seaweed crisps make a wonderful grab a handful snack.  They are lightly salted, non greasy and a perfect cure for the munchies.

comment: It is a little more expensive but it's really tasty.  Crunchy and thin, perfect for snacking. Would definitely buy it again.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2020
comment: Loved this!! It was a great snacking food and a great alternative to popcorn when watching a movie :)

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020
comment: These are delicious

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
comment_title: Rosemary Oleoresin as an ingredient - be careful
comment: I was very hopeful this snack would be wonderful. I liked them. Not terrific, but sort of what is expected when you combine seaweed, salt, rice crackers, and sugar. My objection is about 20 minutes after having a handful I was very hot. And I recalled how there is an odd aftertaste, reminiscent of MSG on the tongue. I checked the ingredients. No MSG. But it does list Rosemary Oleoresin. I Googled this additive and found this: Rosemary Oleoresin is a circulatory and nerve stimulant. Interesting. I definitely did not like the hot flushed sensations and won't be buying this again.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2019
comment: I have tried many brands of seaweed snacks over the years and I usually buy them when I want to try "healthy snacking" but don't stick with them for long. I bought these expecting to abandon them after a few servings, but something about these are different...they are addicting. I don't know what it is, but these are just so dang good. Just the right amount of salt, crispness, and the "ocean-y" aftertaste is goes away pretty quickly. I knew something was superior about these seaweed snacks when I was eating kettle chips and felt unsatisfied because I wanted these seaweed snacks instead. I'm going to buy more!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2018
comment_title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY - BUY IN STORE!
comment: This is a better deal ounce per ounce, pack for pack, any way you look at it it’s a better deal TO BUY THIS IN STORE!!! There were like 5 seaweed sheets PER PACK!! Never will purchase again!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
comment: Looovvee these! Much better than the Costco / Kirkland brandUpdate: Received a new batch which was oily and rubbery. Not like any of the previous patches that I've received.  Contacted Amazon about it waiting for a responseUpdate 2:. Amazon sent out a new batch after this review.  It arrived pretty much the next day - it was much better!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020

I hate that I ate some of the beads before I realized what I was eating.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2020
comment: I was paying $1.99 for a single one of theses! Was worried that he hear would he out of date or something because the price was so low...like $1.25 less per pack! But they aren’t stale. They are just like what I’ve been buying just much less expensive!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2020
comment_title: Best thing i can say, 'It tastes like seaweed'. Worse thing i can say, "'It tastes like seaweed'.
comment: Instead of heading to the local H-Mart (Korean supermarket chain in US) just to pickup seaweed, I decided to look and buy it online. I was concerned after reading some reviews and wondered whether or not there was going to be any difference between this brand and the ones we normally purchase. As my 9 year old was taste testing it, I asked how does this compare to all the other brands we buy.  The reply was, 'It tastes like seaweed'.  Happy to say, kid approved. Just to be sure I grabbed a slice and sure enough, it tastes just like all other brands we have bought. Would I buy it again? I just did!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2019
comment: They are the best seaweed I have bought. There are 20 small packs in each bag and about 10 pieces in each small package . They are a little greasy (from the sunflower oil) but I guess that's why they are so good. Since each package has only 25 calories, who cares! They are from Korea but packaged in American/California (with all the information in English) and totally organic and a great bargain.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020
comment_title: Flavor is good but SO MUCH SALT!
comment: I would've given these 5 stars but OMG - all the salt! I can literally see big coarse ground chunks of salt all over each piece! And its not just a little salt, it covers each piece. I tried to brush it off but that doesn't work with such a thin flimsy piece of seaweed. I have high blood pressure so I stay away from salt, which is ok because I'm fond of it to begin with. I usually buy Seasnax toasted onion which I LOVE! (no chunks or visible salt on theirs) I thought I would stray and try a new brand and came up wanting. If they got rid of all the salt, I would probably buy again, but now I'm just stuck with a bunch of snacks I can't eat.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2020
comment_title: I didn't think I would like it.  Quickly acquired taste.
comment: I am addicted to this stuff even though I thought I was crazy for buying it.  The first few sheets tasted kind of funny because I never liked the smell of seaweed, but I got through it because of the salt and the teriyaki sauce.  Then I started to crave more.  The texture takes your mouth on journey.  The seaweed first starts out crispy like a chip, then it quickly hits the saliva and then feels like a wet, very thin piece of paper.  Then it gets slightly chewy like beef jerky.  Then out of no where, the sheet disappears.  Ha!  I love how it only has one carb per package.  I usually eat 2-3 packages per sitting.  I need to look for a version that has larger servings.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2019
comment_title: Less Flavorful than Any other Seaweed Snacks
comment: Wow!  Considering the popularity of this brand, I never would have guessed I'd find myself writing this review.  Great texture but I seriously thought that I had been sent the wrong kind - I ordered sea salt and would have guessed it was the olive oil flavor.  Maybe I got a bad batch.  It's funny because I had just tried another brand and thought they weren;t flavorful but oh boy do they shine in comparison to these.  Good in soup, though.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2020
comment: These make wonderful snacks especially if you’re craving a little salt as they are a bit salty.  You might find yourself drinking more beer or other beverages while eating these.  (Just like when you eat pretzels or chips at a bar).  The size is perfect for a box or bag lunch but I always wish I had more sheets of nori (the seaweed) once I reach the bottom of the packet.  They’re addictive!  At 25 calories and a single serving per package, it seems that it’s be a good food to eat during a diet.  The inner clear container is recyclable (I can see the recycling symbol on it but can’t read what type of plastic it is.  I think it may be in Asian letters). I like to keep a couple in my car for snacks on-the-go.  At 62 cents a package, it’s at least half the price I’d pay at the grocery store and that’s when it’s on sale.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2018
comment: More like terriyucki, Very stale.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2019
comment: Delicious! I’ve been doing keto for a while know and these are crispy, and yummy and low carb and calorie. I can’t get enough (obviously I order the 20 pack). They satisfy and are so easy to take with me. I eat at least 1 pack a day. Also, the FLAVOR is AMAZING. They are so salty and tangy and taste so good. I get excited when it is finally time for me to eat them and have to hold back from eating them right after breakfast. I think this is the best flavor, but sesame and sea salt are good as well.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2019
comment: Delicious and crispy. My kids devour them. Can’t keep up. I just wish so much plastic wasn’t wasted. Each set is in its own individual plastic box. Not necessary. comment: Either you like seaweed or you don't Texture of this product is smooth, taste is fair. Nothing wrong with it.Plus imagine the health benefits of seaweed. Plenty of individual packs in this lot so was able to share some with friends and co-workers who like seaweed too.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2020

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
comment: I avoid high carb, due to the spike in energy. But too many nuts are way too high in calories because I am also trying not to gain weight and if possible would prefer to lose some. comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020
comment: Seaweed + sea salt... how can you go wrong?! I love these snacks and our house goes through them quickly. Great flavor and alway airtight packaging. Which, I wish there wasn’t so much plastic packaging in these (I eat two at a time), so I’m a little disappointed with that, but overall, I can’t get enough!!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020
comment_title: Great snacks, but price drastically changes
comment: When I first bought this, it was half the price at our grocery. So this is definitely better value on Amazon. A bit disappointed though that it has gone up by $5 in a just a few weeks.Overall, these are yummy and healthy snacks. Every now and then, you get an oily pack, but generally most are just right.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2020
comment: I've been eating roasted seaweed for a couple years (mostly Jayone) - it's great when I feel like eating something but am not particularly hungry, as it's very low in calories and won't make me feel stuffed.I'd gotten kind of tired of the standard salted flavor so this teriyaki version is a great treat! It has a pronounced teriyaki flavor, and at least on the first day of eating it the seaweed was crisp and tasted fresh (as fresh as one can expect from dried seaweed - point is, it wasn't rancid).Significantly more expensive than Jayone, but they don't make teriyaki.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2020
comment: Now when I first tried these I was a bit skeptical because I have never had a seaweed snack before so the flavor was very different for me.  The more I continued to eat the pack, the more hooked I became!  Now I absolutely love them and they have pretty much replaced my potato chips as a snack.  The saltiness and crunch is mainly what I enjoy when I have chips so this is a much healthier alternative.  I will continue to buy these little bundles of goodness!!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018

Hopefully I'll get accustomed to the fishyness & will be able to branch out to other even non-flavored kinds.

comment: I personally prefer the original, this one is less salty. It came in good condition and doesn’t taste bad., but I just prefer it saltier.

comment: I really like the healthy alternative aspect for a snack that this provides. The flavor is good. The package size is good. The only complaint I have is that my 10 year old doesn't care for it.

comment: Nice smooth tasting seaweed...no fishy taste...I have  other weird friends who have come to visit and enjoy a cup of licorice tea and seaweed!

comment: It takes a lot to gross me out, bravo you did it. The flavor has a dirty aquarium taste with a side of fish. What made it worse was it sticks to the roof of your mouth and you can't spit it out. Hope it was a bad batch and others have a better experience with it.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2020
comment_title: Not the best price, but a delicious product

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2020
comment: Taste like fish, but not in a good way. Hoping I can get my Iodine another way, not sure what to do with the rest of these 19 packs of seaweed :( UghI feel like the other people who wrote the reviews had no taste buds. I love sushi and eating healthy, but even I have my limits.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
comment: Ordered the 20 pack with a subscription hoping they’d be similar to a brand I regularly purchase at Walmart. I canceled my subscription immediately after trying them and I’ll be contacting amazon to return them if possible ASAP

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2019
comment: I've tried the GimMe roasted seaweed flavors sea salt, olive oil, sesame oil, and teriyaki and like them all. I had tried another brand years ago and didn't like it, so I was dubious about any "fishy" taste even though I know it's fish that taste like algae (which seaweed is) and not really the reverse... Apparently this brand is mild enough for me.I like to eat them with a little bit of nut or seed butter, with the nori sheets rolled up or folded over or covered with another sheet like a sandwich. I usually eat 2 to 4 small sheets at a time. The remainder in the pack stays fresh if I just put the plastic tray in a sandwich bag and seal with a clothes pin. But I have to keep this bag in a rodent-proof container because apparently a little visitor from the crawlspace thought they were delicious... just a plastic bag was not enough protection!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020
comment_title: Great Quality But Poor Quantity & Poor Package Labeling!
comment: Purchased this Healthy  Product after looking at Images but 20 Packages Per 10 Flakes versus COSTCO Kirkland 10 Packages Per 50 Flakes. Big difference in Kirkland 500 Seaweed Flakes than GimMe 200 Flakes. Same on Pricing 20 Packages of only 200 Flakes for over $15.00 far more than Kirkland 10 Containers of 500 for $10.00?  provides 50 Flakes per Package providing 500 Flakes for far less money. Additionally, same taste and crunchy as all taste the same to me. Had to Returning the Packages but Amazon was great in accommodating my complaint since I studied the Images and could not reach an Amazon Tech Customer Service due to Virus Limitations before buying GimME. Very disappointed in such overpricing and inaccurate labeling and far less Quantity. The Product is just as good as Kirkland just less for Higher Price. The same goes for Kakoa Friends Brands. They did not provide Flake Number per container unlike COSCTCO providing 50 Flakes per Container on Labels. Once they change Quantity with a Competitive Price they will sell more with less Costs on Packaging. Until then, why 200 when 500 is chaper and of Equal Quality?

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
comment_title: I love Gimme Teriyaki flavor! A review great for those paying close attention to sodium/nutrition
comment: Let me start by saying I LOVE Seaweed snacks. If you're someone who has never tried seaweed snacks before, I would start with Gimme brand Teriyaki flavor to introduce you to it!! This product tastes amazing, and doesn't taste overly greasy/oily like other seaweed snack brands sometimes do. This review is specifically for people watching their sodium intake/are on a sodium restriction/are interesting in hearing my perspective on this brand.I am a Registered Dietitian and often pay close attention to what I chose for myself so that I can better make recommendations for friends/family/clients, and I love that one pack (0.17oz) has 30mg of sodium (salt) and is such a nice healthy delicious snack! For anyone who is put on a low salt diet, depending on what your restriction is (again disclaimer, first check with your doctor and RD) you can comfortably have 3 of these 0.17oz packs, and still be eating less than 100mg of salt.  Something to always look for when checking nutrition facts of snacks is whether or not the information you see in the nutrition label is for the whole container, or if it has multiple servings (in which you would want to multiply whatever you see in the label by the number of servings).I have seen other seaweed snack brands have up to 500mg of sodium or more per seaweed pack which is so insane!! Personally, I am very sensitive to salt so other brands with lots of sodium usually cause me to wake up feeling so swollen, but the Gimme Teriyaki flavor is much lower in salt than other brands so I can relax knowing that if I'm craving it I can relax knowing a few packs won't bother me! I love it! Definitely recommend!Note: The other Gimme Seaweed snack flavors, Sesame Flavor and the Sea Salt, have 65mg per the same 0.17oz bags (still not bad). Still not bad, but I probably would not recommend more than about two 0.17 oz packs for the Sesame and Sea Salt flavors for someone on a strict sodium restriction from their doctor. However, just be careful because the larger 0.35oz size bags for both flavors have 130mg for a whole pack (they mention that they have 65mg per serving with 2 servings).Overall, I think that the Gimme Teriyaki flavor is a great choice given that it is only 30mg sodium per pack compared to 65mg salt per pack of the other flavors, and that even for the larger 0.35 oz of the Teriyaki packs they only have 60 mg salt for the whole pack compared to 130mg per 0.35oz pack of the Sesame and Sea Salt flavors.

comment: These hit all the places: salty, sweet, wasabi. Omg. Don't even think twice. If you like wasabi, you will LOVE these. I love them! They're excellent in quality (roast) and taste amazing. Will definitely buy again!!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020
comment: My friend offered me some of these when I was visiting her house and I looked at her like she was crazy. You just eat slices of seaweed by itself? What's wrong with you? It's good, she assured me. Well, I do like sushi, so I hesitantly agreed to try her weird seaweed in a plastic box snack. How can I put into words the feelings that overtook me when my tongue first encountered the papery goodness of these seaweed snacks? How do I describe the exquisite blend of seasonings that tickled my tastebuds into an all out joygasm? These things are like crack and I am an addict. They taste as good as pure, uncut blow. I ate six packets yesterday and ordered more. This is where all my money will go from now on. Rent? Electricity? Who needs that when you can spend your entire pay check on thin slices of seaweed grilled and seasoned to perfection? I hope whoever runs this company enjoys getting filthy rich off me until I hit rock bottom and check into seaweed rehab.

I've had several cases of them, and have never had problems with broken ones. I used to take them in my lunch and would just throw them in my tote and they remained intact.

These packs ARE very large though so I only take half of a package with me and put the other half in a zip top bag for the next day.They always taste fresh and delicious and I am afraid to try another brand now as I have become so attached to these.

I need to check my account to figure out the return and refund procedure.

comment_title: Normally a good purchase but watch for defective ones
comment: I got 2 orders and they were shipped separately. I order these regularly and typically am happy w the product. The first box delivered were defective, none had the silica packet in them to maintain freshness so they were soggy. 2nd package arrived a few days later and were fine. I'm not sure how to get a return or refund on the one bc in my orders they are invoiced togeth and it says they were delivered on the same day which they weren't.

It's like eating straight up seaweed with a hint of salt/wasabi.  Would not recommend.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2016
comment: I am obsessed with these!!!  Wal-Mart use to sell it, and I always cleaned out their shelves.  I end up eating a whole bad in one sitting.  Sometimes, luckily not often, even though it's not close to the expiration date, you might end up with one bag where they are stale...but that isn't something that can be foreseen.  Love when I have one batch that is super fresh, and wish all were like that.  I also like the Wasabi ones, but for some reason went back to these, because have noticed that the majority of the batches, are overloaded with wasabi, which doesn't make it as enjoyable to eat anymore.  I would recommend these, but again, never a guarantee that all batches, even when still within the expiration date, are super fresh/regular freshness.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2019

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2019

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2019

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2018
comment: Ok, these are delicious. I was a fan. But I always felt unwell after eating them.  I’m allergic to coconut... spoiler alert, apparently these have coconut oil in them! So what, you say? Well, I’d carefully read the ingredients list on Amazon, and there’s no coconut oil listed. I didn’t realize that’s what was up until a friend pointed it out.Long story short, five stars for taste, but they seriously need to address the ingredients list on here.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2019
comment_title: Great when it’s great but inconsistent at times!
comment: This is a household staple we absolutely love this product! However the past few batches has been extremely inconsistent. It appears far less amount of seaweed vs the normal batch. The saltiness and slickness just haven’t been hitting the mark and I don’t understand why! I tried reaching out to the company directly with no response.We are an avid consumer of this product I’m talking 2-6 bags a day eaten in my household so I would definitely know!Bottom line this is a great product with great flavor I just don’t understand the hit or miss aspect of it... would love for the company to respond to my concerns and let me know! Yummy

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2017
comment: I LOVE seaweed snacks. I have tried several brands and this one is so far my favourite! I have only tried the Wasabi flavour, and I won't be changing that for a while! These are very fresh and flavourful, unlike others where you can barely feel any seasoning. If you like putting wasabi on your sushi then you will surely like the taste of this. It has that slightly spicy/slightly sweet blend, and it's salty too. Whenever I'm craving a snack or something crispy to munch on, these are the healthiest and lowest calories snacks I can think of that satisfy that snack urge and actually fills you up for a while. At first the little singular packet might look small (there's about 20 slices of seaweed in each packet) but it keeps me full for a couple of hours. Highly recommend if you like the taste of sushi!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2011
comment: I first got hooked on the plain version of these from Trader Joe's; from there, I found the Wasabi flavor at Whole Foods and what can I say: I'm completely ADDICTED!! But it's not a rancid taste or anything like that. If you don't like the taste of fish, these and other SEAweed products are probably are not for you, but if you enjoy a nice Asian-themed snack, these are PERFECT!! Ordering them on Amazon is definitely a savings over Whole Foods and so far - several orders later - I haven't had any problems with quality, cost or shipment.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2011

Try one before buying a crate of it. However, if you do like the spicy stuff, you won't find any better than this.Also, Amazon's prices are excellent -- a 12-pack that costs $20 from Annie Chun directly costs only $15 here.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2017
comment: This product is great when you open it but wilts very quickly.  I wish the packaging had a reseal to keep the crunch for more than one day. Otherwise very tasty and just the right amount of salt.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2011
comment: I love the taste of seaweed and wasabi, and have an unsatisfiable love for spicy foods.  I have had other brands of wasabi seaweed snacks, and these are by FAR the spiciest.  I saw someone mention that the spice is variable, so it's possible I've eaten extra spicy packs, I suppose, but these have enough kick to "clear your sinuses".  If you like your spicy food no hotter than "medium" you will probably find these too spicy.  If you love hot foods, you'll probably be pleased that these are hotter than most "hot" chips (including potato chips) you've tried.  These are also less greasy than other brands of seaweed snacks.I love them.  Seaweed isn't for anyone as people mentioned.  Sure it tastes fishy.  Do you like the tase of the seaweed in sushi?  If you haven't tried sushi, then this might not be the best intro to seaweed.  If you have had sushi and you particularly like or dislike the seaweed taste there, that should predict pretty well whether you'll like these.  For me, these easily remind me of the taste of sushi with wasabi.I love these and will be buying more.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2020
comment: Loves these

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2012
comment: I ordered some of these Annie Chun's Seaweed Snacks after watching a friend much on roasted seaweed.  After searching on amazon, I chose these and two flavors from Sea's Gift.  I chose the Roasted Sesame flavor over the other flavors because the ingredients are simpler.  Each package has small (but not tiny) rectangles of seaweed lined up on a tray.  I fold the pieces in half and stuff them in my mouth.  I find that if I bite the seaweed, I get more "crumbs."  Either way, I still wind up with pieces of seaweed on my shirt and have to check myself in the mirror after eating (also pieces get stuck in my teeth like spinach, so I have learned to check that, too). I like the texture of this seaweed-paper thin, light, and crisp.  I like the flavor-mild.  I prefer this brand to Sea's Gift because of the milder flavor.  They seem fresh.  I did not detect any off-tastes or rancidity.  I appreciate the high vitamin content and the low calories.  I reach for these when I want something crunchy.  I eat them as a snack in between meals to keep me from eating crackers. I also eat them along side a meal instead of crackers.

Annie Chun's version of this snack is the one I usually get. The roasted sesame flavor is something agreeable to most American palettes, although their wasabi flavored snacks are also good.A note about storage: Once you open these, you want to make sure they're consumed pretty quickly or stored in a dry place. They don't stay crisp long once open, especially if it's humid.

My supervisor likes these with smoked salmon spread. Sounds good, but I have not tried it yet. I have a coworker who does not like seaweed. comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2015
comment_title: Delicious Ocean Leaves For Your Munching Pleasure! (or at lease for my wife's...)
comment: It pains me to write this because I personally despise all edibles from the briny, or otherwise fresh, natural bodies of water that make up the majority of our shared living sphere, Earth.  However, as my wife and I share this account, I am compelled to wax eloquently on her behalf in regards to the alleged deliciousness of Annie Chun's Seaweed Snacks, Roasted Wasabi, 0.35-Ounce Packages (Pack of 12).  While the smell of an open container of these crumble sea crisps is enough to make me hurl like a sailing student in a sea storm (a bit of an exaggeration), they seem to consistently please the misses, who has described them as "spicy" and "yummy."  Additionally pleasing to her is the ability to subscribe and save and leave open containers on the coffee table to torture yours truly.  Sea snackers, please eat responsibly.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2012
comment: My wife and I love these and we had these on subscription, but they just got to be too expensive. Then we found similar snacks at one of the local Asian Grocery stores. They had products from several manufacturers, so we tried a bunch. They ALL basically tasted the same, so we now just buy the ones that are on sale. They are under $4.00 for 8 pack and 10 pack units (depending on the brand). THIS IS MUCH CHEAPER THAN THE PRICE OF THESE ON AMAZON. Since we eat these all the time, this is much more economical for us. My wife hates the "fresh" taste of fish, but she loves these, so I am surprised that people found them too "fishy".

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2011
comment: I have to admit, before I opened up the Seaweed Snacks, I was expecting a thicker snack because of the picture on the box. When I saw the actual product...I thought...* Wow!...They are sooo thin!.. *Will they have flavor?..*Would they be filling?...  *Will we munch half the boxes up in one sitting trying to feel like we ate something?, and *Did I waste my money?*... Our answer: Definitely NOT wasted money! To our suprise, yesterday, my husband and I shared one .35 oz. pkg, which, with a drink, and found that not only was our serving of the "wafers" filling enough to take our hunger away until dinner, but was also very tasty!...(Actually, it was so tasty that today, I ate a whole pkg myself!... They're sooo addicting!!!). The seaweed flavor is strong enough for its taste to come through, but yet, subtle enough to not overwhelm the tastebuds...Yummy!! My husband and I liked the snack so much, I told two of our neighbors about them and let them try some. They also liked them alot, so I gave them each a pkg. to take with them. We even broke the snack into little pieces and let my neighbors' 6 mos. baby suck on them until soft, (when put in the mouth, the hard *wafer* texture  almost immediately  dissolves into the texture of cooked spinach). Once softened she ate about 3 wafers right down!  (If you do let your young child try it..I would strongly recommend an adult breaking, holding, and feeding the small wafer pieces on his/her fingers for the child.) My neighbor said to her husband, *She, (the baby), loves them, too...We have to buy some!*I'm  glad I've found this snack, as being Seaweed, it has soo many more nutritional benefits,(necessary vitamins and minerals, and being low in fat), that I believe it is a great alternative to many of the other snacks that are being sold. It does, however, have a little more salt on it than I would like...(health wise).  It would be nice if they came out with a low,(or at least a lower salt), seaweed snack package...but even if they dont..I will continue to buy these due to their delicious flavor!Anyway, to summarize it all we decided that  [[ASIN:B003NUYBV8 Annie Chun's Seaweed Snacks, Roasted Sesame, 0.35-Ounce Packages (Pack of 12)] will be the Perfect Snack for us and would definitely recommend them!  Sarah

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2015
comment_title: If you like dried seaweed and savoury/salty, these snacks are for you.
comment: If you like seaweed and tend toward savoury / salty snacks, then these are delicious. They look like pieces of "green" paper, each about the size of a Post-It Note. Good for a (very) light snack, especially if you want to avoid the caloric issues of chips and so on.There are "2 servings" per container - a serving" is about 9 sheets. If you choose to ziplock the leftovers, keep the little silica bag that comes inside (to keep them crisp, or they can turn a little rubbery, depending on how many days you keep them before eating). Kept unopened in their original packaging, they'll keep for ages.

This one got some solid reviews, so I ordered a small case. Immediately my problem became, "Would I even try to get through this whole thing, have to dump it at some point  or found  a chi chi soup kitchen somewhere to "donate" it to needy yuppies and millennials.It's- despite modest calories-  a bit too salty, "sharp', oily, devoid of a sesame seed hint, and sorta cheap soy sauce bitter, vastly unlike the fresh varieties I've enjoyed. It's a little difficult imagining why some go back for more.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2012
comment_title: Great for people who don't like seaweed
comment: Don't get me wrong, this snack does tastes like the seaweed it is.  BUT of all the seaweed snacks I've tried, and I've tried half a dozen at my local health food store, THIS is the one I decided to buy in bulk as a subscription on Amazon (FYI: I spend a fortune at that local health food store, so don't feel too sorry for it, and I have to strike a balance on spending somewhere!).  What makes this snack better than the others?  Three things: 1) the seaweed is in small sheets and is much thinner -- you don't get a big thick layer of it, 2) it has a great distracting hot & salty taste (salt & wasabi) that gives it a refreshing zing, and 3) it has nice crispiness.  I eat sea vegetables for general health (anti-cancer, etc.) and thyroid health.  A few sheets of these a day and I'm good.  For the first time  (not counting sushi) it's easy to eat my seaweed.

comment: Be aware that these are the type of thing you probably either really like or really don't like, and if you don't care for sushi you probably won't like these. Yes, that sounds like a "Duh" statement, but they really are sort of fishy. Crispy texture, and a nice little wasabi kick, but don't let them sit on your tongue too long or they sort of melt and taste very seaweedy. My husband spit out his one and only taste, but I thought they were pretty good. On the other hand, a co-worker actually gagged and wiped her tongue after one bite. Very crunchy and thin, but a little bit goes a long way for me. I don't think I'll order them again simply because I'd eat them occasionally but not as my first choice for a snack. I do like the wasabi tingle, but I'll stick to wasabi peas.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2012
comment: Completely different from anything I've ever had before. My first impression of these seaweed snacks was "salted cellophane," but then I gave it a moment, tried another, and another.They're very mild in taste. Like paper thin greens kissed with salt, that start out crunchy and completely soften in your mouth. I tried a single pack bought elsewhere and liked it enough to come back here for the case. They're tasty, but messy. If they were a a little narrower, you could more easily fit a whole one in your mouth and eat neatly. And they tend to disintegrate and stick to your teeth so I wouldn't eat these at work, but at home with dinner, or as a snack, sure, no problem.Snackable vegetables, seriously. While they're not particularly filling, they're kind of fun to eat and are supposed to be pretty good for you. High in vit. A and 30 calories for half a package. (20 calories fat of the 30, from the oil)I ate these 3-4 sheets at a time and stored the open package in the fridge. They stayed crunchy until I finished the package, which took me about 3 days.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2012
comment: I first tasted Annie Chun's seaweed three years ago while in California. It was delicious, especially the Wasabi, so I purchased about ten packs. After returning home, I found it could be ordered from Amazon at a very reasonable price and have purchased them regularly ever since. NO MORE! The last shipment contained a few packages that did not smell right. The pieces of seaweed had a dull, grey coating on them. They tasted terrible. I blew it off the first couple of times and went ahead with another shipment. Last night I opened a container that smelled of burning plastic. The pieces were once again dull and appeared to have a grey coating on them. The coating, unfortunately, was not wasabi. It is strange that not all of the packages have the smell or coating on them, but now I am uncomfortable eating the product. I trusted Annie Chun's product but have decided to stop purchasing it, going with my intuition that there is a problem at the source they are not addressing.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2012
comment: I ordered these because I thought they'd be a great snack when kayaking. A lot of bulky packaging. I had no idea what to expect. These are oily to the touch, bland and salty. (Yes, I know seaweed is salty) but the flavor was just oily salt. I'm not a potato chip person, so maybe if you're a chip-person, these may appeal to you a bit more. I had to use a lot of hand sanitizer to degrease my hands afterwards. (Don't carry napkins in yak) I'll be eating them elsewhere with some chipolte powder.Interestingly, no fiber in these, so it wasn't filling at all. Kinda pointless. Not a lot of calories, but not enough nutritional bang.And a warning - plan on brushing your teeth afterwards - had pieces stuck in my teeth the rest of the day.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2015
comment: I found these to be completely disappointing.  I was looking for a healthy, low-carb snack with crunch.  The description/reviews seemed to imply that's what these were.  I was thinking they'd be like kale chips, and I've also had seaweed based snacks that I enjoyed in the past, so I rolled the dice.  I'm a pretty adventurous eater, so why not?  When the box arrived (unfortunately, I'm stuck with 12 packages of these now), I opened the first package and reached in-- what I pulled out was as thin as the thinnest paper (translucent, in fact), and flexible-- when bent in half, they tear a little but do not 'snap.'  There went my hopes of a satisfying crunch.  Still, I ate one.  It tasted like fish, not sesame, and the texture became slimy as I chewed.  In fact, they get nice and wedged into the crevasses of your molars like toffee, so you get to enjoy that fishy taste for a while!  I ate one more "crisp" just to be sure I hadn't gotten a bad one... and... yep.  I can't face a third one, even for science.  These were not enjoyable and I suspect I will be hard-pressed to find them a good home.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2016
comment: I was very curious about these. I love sushi so I thought I'd try these. At first sight, I thought they were alot thinner than I had imagined. At first taste, I wasn't sure I liked them...ate a couple more sheets and I was addicted. Subtle but satisfying saltiness, hint of lovely sesame, ahh. Heaven. I take a package of these to work with me to snack on. So good!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2012
comment: These seaweed snacks were an impulse item, and I'm so glad we tried them.  There are 12 individually sealed packages in the box, and each package has about 20 super-thin seaweed snacks.  They're almost thin enough to read through, and the whole container only has 2 carbs, making them perfect for low-carb dieters.  They're surprisingly filling, and not overly salty.  They are extremely crispy and the entire package should be eaten soon after opening.  Humidity will make them gummy in just a short time.The nutrition information from Annie Chun's website says that each package of this sesame flavor has: 60 calories, 2 grams protein, 140 mg sodium, 5 grams of fat, 70% of daily vitamin A, 12% of daily vitamin C, and minerals (unnamed on the ingredients list).I like that these are all-natural and don't contain preservatives or food coloring.  I like that it's a novel way to eat vegetables, and that my kids love them. Next we'll try the wasabi flavor.My only complaint about this product is that they use canola oil in them.  Canola oil is in so many foods we eat, and the process used to make it (hexane - a petroleum product, and high heat) causes it to produce free radicals in our body.  Free radicals are linked to obesity, heart disease and degenerative diseases in our bodies.  I would much prefer that all foods be made with cold-pressed oils like olive, peanut or sunflower oil.But canola oil aside, these seaweed snacks are delicious, filling, low carb, and we'll be buying them again.

Its a little strong, and its actually more spicy for the nose than the mouth (if you inhale it, it's not a pleasant feeling, but I don't know why anyone would just sniff it). Anyway, i love roasted seaweed, but wasabi is just okay.

comment_title: Annie Chun's Roasted Seaweed Snacks Sesame
comment: Bursting with a strong fishy/seafoody taste and a touch of salt. YUM! The crunchy lightweight sheets of seaweed come organized in a clear plastic tray like file folders in a cabinet. This snack doesn't exactly fill you up. I went through my first 3 packs in under 5 minutes. It's simply not designed to be a main dish. Instead, use it on occasion for whenever you feel the need to have your taste buds wracked by some awesome umami flavor!

Each .35oz of product has a bag, plastic tray, and anti-moisture package, it would be nice if there were a bulk order option that was several oz of sheets in a single plastic wrap, like you would see for seaweed sheets used for sushi.
