comment: Do not buy. Possible health hazard.My girlfriend bought this seaweed because she likes to eat healthy snacks. Little did she know that the package was infested with ants. (see pictures). She ended up eating the entire package in the dark while watching TV after work and only realizing this after the fact. This is completely and utterly disgusting and unacceptable.In this instance we are appalled by amazon's quality control standard when it comes to food products such as this one.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2013
comment_title: I only gave one star because you have to give at least one...
comment: Pop quiz!  Where does seaweed come from?  What do Annie Chuns seaweed snacks taste like?  If you answered "the ocean" for both of these then give yourself the star I gave this review...

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019
comment_title: Best tasting, light crispy and clean. Not overly seaweed tasting with a nasty filmy aftertaste.
comment: I've eaten a lot of seaweed snacks over the decades and Annie Chun's are by far my favorite in taste and texture. Sea Salt and Sesame flavor are fantastic, Wasabi ... not so much, way too strong on the wasabi. Oddly enough, many seaweed snacks can be overly seaweed tasting, maybe too heavy, pressed or cut too thick and often too oily. Trader Joe's has their version in large packs for a dollar, but I rarely finish a single pack as they are just too heavy and don't leave me wanting anymore, I've tried on several occasions. Nasty seaweed snacks often leave a filmy aftertaste in your mouth and the seasonings just don't taste balanced or right, especially as more longterm snack. And that's what I like about Annie Chun's, these snack are pressed thin, have a light crispy chew that breaks down easily, and don't leave your mouth with a gross lingering overwhelming aftertaste from bad seasoning or too much oil. The larger 0.35 oz packs are certainly the way to go compared to those tiny 0.16 oz which I can devour in under a few minutes. Found the larger cases on sale at my local Asian grocer and bought them out, I can easily eat three or more packages of the Sesame or Sea Salt a day without getting burnt out on the flavor and texture. Finding these for a dollar or less is a pretty good deal as average individual packing pricing on most other brands is around $1 for the 0.16 oz. and $2 and up for the 0.35 oz. Hoping I can keep Annie Chun's seaweed snacks stocked in the home all the time.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2016
comment_title: Good & Bad Batches? Mine was OK.
comment: Lots of negative reviews by Amazon customers, so decided to pick one up to try at...ahem...our local Walmart. Noting ingredients sunflower and sesame oils (not canola!) and "Best Before" date a reasonable 5 months hence on "4.28.2017" took one home and just now had some with Nishiki sushi style rice. As a nori lover for at least 60 years I can say that taste and texture were as good as it gets, not "fishy" as reported by others. Took off a star because IMO it was a bit too messy oily compared to others I have enjoyed.As a side note, I would be more confident purchasing food products from Amazon if shelf life expiration dates are posted. And, with sufficient negative customer reviews a product should be checked for quality. That said, I have and will continue to purchase items not available in local grocery outlets and so far practically all been satisfactory.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2014
comment_title: low-calorie and should appeal to people who like the taste of sesame
comment: I recently had a chance to try these.  They're not my favorite thing ever, but they do have some good qualities.  First of all, a serving is only 30 calories.  Granted, they're quite thin and not very substantial.  But enough effort is involved in eating them that you at least feel like you've gone through the motions of eating a snack, and often, for me, that's enough to get rid of my mid-afternoon hunger/boredom.Taste-wise, these remind me of many other kinds of seaweed (nori that I've had with vegetarian California rolls, kombu pieces that end up in my beans, etc.).  I can really taste the sesame oil, as well.  And these are fairly salty, although one serving only has 70 mg of sodium (3% of what you should get daily).  I do not understand why so many of the negative reviewers thought these tasted like fish.  There's no fish in them -- they're vegan!  They're also quite high in vitamin A.These are not going to appeal to everyone.  If you are fond of Asian food, especially Japanese or Korean food, you will probably be a fan of these.  These do leave a bit of oil on your fingertips, by the way.They seem to be pretty shelf-stable.  I left a completely open package on my desk overnight and they tasted the same the first day (and have the same texture) as they did the second day.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2011
comment_title: Very good if you love wasabi flavor/bite and seaweed snacks in general
comment: Only get these if you like the taste of wasabi. Although it's a bit more subtle then the wasabi that's dabbed on your sushi, you still definitely get the wasabi bite (they seem to be along the same line of the extra spicy wasabi covered peas, maybe a little bit saltier).  With subscribe and save, these packs come out to $1/pack which is quite a bit cheaper than what you spend outside Amazon (Whole Foods, Trader Joe's or supermarket) for this type of snack.  You do get quite a few sheets in each pack (20) and each one is seasoned with the perfect amount of spicy/hot wasabi and salt.  They are also nice and crunchy since they are packaged separately, and they do not seem as greasy as some other brands I've tried from the Asian markets. Although they are not greasy, one package (which contains two 10-sheet servings) has a total of 4 grams of fat (which is a little above my 3 gram target for low fat foods and unfortunately I cannot eat only half a pack.  They seem to lose their crunchiness once they're opened...that's my excuse for eating the entire pack and I'm sticking to it).

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2020
comment_title: BAD BATCH!  ANNIE CHUN WON'T RESPOND!
comment: I used to love these and eat them all the time!  Then, when I bought a bunch of them, I was super disappointed to find that there was no wasabi taste and the seaweed was stale and bland.  I thought that maybe I had a bad package, so I opened 8 more and they all tasted just as bad!I emailed the company and I have been waiting over 4 MONTHS, and haven't heard anything!!!  They clearly just blew me off!  I will not be buying anymore Annie Chun products!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2016
comment: Could not wait to try healthy snack, love seaweed! Hate the leakage from packs! Thought it was just the one that I tryed that was leaking at first! Then I looked at the bottom of box and pack trays, oil every where! More than one packet was leaking!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2016
comment_title: Good healthy snack if you like the texture of seaweed.
comment: I tried these before when I saw them at Target and I had to buy more. They are a great snack when you crave something to eat, but are not that hungry. They are low in calories and rather healthy for a snack and if you are dieting eating a few of these is better than going for a full meal. I tried some Costco brand salt seaweed snacks although the Costco seaweed snacks have more in one package they do seem cheaper if that is possible for seaweed snacks and Annie Chun's were more flavorful. The wasabi flavoring is not too strong, but there is a noticeable kick to them. If you are a spicy food fanatic like me you might not notice the spice as much, but when I shared some others though they did think there was some kick to them. The price is about standard from Amazon as the seaweed snacks I got from Costco were similarly priced.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2012
comment_title: I really like these; they've inspired me to make my own
comment: I'd been curious about seaweed snacks for quite some time.  After trying a pack of Annie Chun's Seaweed Snacks, I have to say I am a fan.  The snacks are perfect as just that -- a snack.  They have 60 calories per container so you don't have to feel bad about eating one or two containers.The seaweed is thin but has a crispy component.  There is a bit of salt but I wouldn't say that these are anywhere near as salty as a Lay's potato chip.  Initially, the smell of the seaweed seemed very strong.  I don't eat fish but that was all I could think of when eating the first few pieces.  After a while, I didn't notice the scent so much.There are two things that I don't like about this product.  The first is the amount of packaging.  The second is the use of canola oil.  To deal with both, I've started to make my own snacks.  I use nori and apply coconut oil or sesame oil and salt and place it in the oven for a bit.  For those that think these are too salty, the make your own method allows you to control the amount of oil and salt.Made in Korea.If interested in trying a single package of Annie Chun's and your grocery store does not carry the product, try iherb.com. If interested in iherb, you can use code LEK375 for a discount.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2013
comment: This product is made with a dry seaweed, sesame oil, and salt.  It is delicious!  I was also happy with the quantity in this product.  I would definitely buy it again. You might find this product at your local super market under Asian section or at the organic health store.  If you're thinking about getting Korean food online then I would advise you to be careful about Komart.com.  Not only did I not receive my stuff from them they won't even respond to my emails.  Komart.com told me to send them my information so I went to my bank and sent them a copy of my check that they cashed but they won't contact me.  Buy your stuff from other online sites.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2016
comment_title: Decent quality, other brands just as good or better.
comment: I like the Annie Chun brand but then I like all brands of this popular packaging style. There are dozens of suppliers so it is a mystery why this one is supposedly the top seller. They  all use the same packaging format of sheets stacked in trays with dessicant and a foil bag. At philam dot com you can get many brands for $7/dz. I eat it every day so it pays to shop around. You can get these sheets with perilla oil(like sesame but more tasty), grape seed oil, olive oil and green tea ans well as spicy versions.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2017
comment_title: NASTY! HARMFUL EAT AT OWN RISK!! BLECH!!
comment: NAASTY!! Stay away from this flavor!! I have been scarfing down the Annie Chun's sesame flavor like crazy, that particular flavor I'd give 5 stars to, but this one I bought to try something new. I was at work and opened the bag and just laid one chip down on my tongue. My Tongue went instantly NUMB and pain went through my mouth as I ran to the sink. Spitting it out before the saliva could carry that numbing pain to the rest of my mouth I spat out what I could and swished my mouth with cupfuls of ice water. I'm not wimp. I've eaten spicy foods before but these are absolutely HARMFUL and TOXIC! I don't know if it was the wasabi or the mustard oil they put on them, but I threw the whole bag away. I didn't want ANY of my friends or Co-workers near those things. Save your money! Get the sesame ones instead. I heard they put out a maple sugar one too. Get those even, just stay away from those horrible things!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2013
comment: I bought these as well as the Wasabe flavor from Amazon and definitely prefer this flavor.Annie Chun's Seaweed Snack is a bit salty, but it accents the crispness beautifully to meld into a soft tasty treat. It is a bit filling, but maybe because I personally have replaced my usual popcorn in the evening.These are also roasted very flavor-fully. Anyone that has tried them, loves them and asks me where I get them.I now order 4 boxes of the sesame flavor a month. We go through it and are feel healthier for it. Thanks!Pros:FlavorNutritionCaloric IntakeCrispnessCons:Cost a bit high compared to buying in a specialty store, but how often does one need to go there now? Hmmm, I may need to rethink something... Love the mom and pop stores too, so I will support them. I'm dropping down to 2 boxes.Thanks Amazon for having this on Subscribe and Save.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2013
comment: For quite some time, I've been buying TaoKaeNoi seaweed chips at my local asian grocery.  One day I happened to find these in the mini-mart and bought them to see if they were better/worse than what I had been getting previously.As far as taste goes, these are the same thing as the TaoKaeNoi product, but the individual chips (sheets?) are thinner and more delicately packaged.  I like both products for the most part, but I think I like the texture of the thicker chips better.Now for the price.  This product is ounce-for-ounce twice as expensive as the product from the asian market.  A 1.27 oz bag of TaoKaeNoi is only $2 whereas this product is $3.64/oz according to the information at the top of the page.  I think for the cheaper price I can easily handle looking at a bag with a foreign language written all over it and I otherwise don't understand why this product is so much more expensive.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2011
comment_title: What's not to like about these? (...other than the addiction!)
comment: Well, I suppose if you don't like spicy food, these might not be your thing. And if you don't like wonderfully tasty, crispy (and healthy!) snacks, they might not be your thing either!But I'm guessing you already passed these by if you fall into the former category, and I'm guessing not many people fit into the latter.My only complaint with these is that the wasabi coating seems to be slightly variable on them, as in I'll have one piece that's moderately hot, and then another that's really not at all. These are horribly addictive too, so it's not like I can just eat a couple of them anyways! They're fairly healthy, which makes me not feel as bad about sucking down a whole pack, but my wallet is more of a limiting factor than my appetite on buying these damn things!In short, these are tasty but moderately spicy. If you like wasabi, you'll love them. If you like seaweed (in whatever form; seaweed salad, on/around your sushi, etc), you'll love them. If you think you hate seaweed since it sounds icky, I bet you'll still love them!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2013
comment: I've had seaweed on sushi and loved it and the lovely Japanese rice crackers with the seaweed baked on, but never had seaweed snack in a pouch before. Wow!  I love these and the Wasabi is my favorite.I'm not so much into eating the flat sheets plain but using the small sheets to pick up a spoonful amount of rice and having a rice and seaweed packet to pop into my mouth.Makes plain brown rice really tasty! Add a little balsamic vinegar and the flavors combined are truly delicious.The wasabi is spicy but not overpowering.Not fishy tasting but more like how the coast or the ocean smells to me. And I have a very sensitive nose and taste buds.I've tried the Sesame and the Wasabi and like them both and look forward to finding more flavors to try.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2017
comment_title: I love seaweed snacks and I picked the Wasabi flavor expecting ...
comment: I love seaweed snacks and I picked the Wasabi flavor expecting a little heat as I love Wasabi on my sushi... these were salty and hot from the wasabi and disgusting  - so much so that I threw the single opened pack away. I won't be buying this again. Anyone would like this that has no taste buds, likes extremely salty foods.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2017
comment_title: i come for the weed . . . sea?
comment: The case of 12 packages showed up in a cardboard box that was wet on all sides of the inside of the box from leaking packages.  There was an abundance of sesame oil inside each package, but since they leaked there was oil on the Outside of each individual package too. Kind of a pain to wipe all packages and have to keep them in a separate bag and not in the cabinet with the rest of my dry foods.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2014
comment: Perfect amount of flavor in every bite. A healthy snack, which helps with dieting. It's really addictive though. Individually packed vertically in a container, which helps with the leftover seaweed. Every container has about 20 sheets, which is very generous. Seaweed is not as crunchy and heavy as the Tao brand, which has less wasabi flavor on each sheet and the flavor is not as evenly distributed. Be careful not eat too much because the wasabi flavor is quite strong and the flavor can cause the same sensation as too much wasabi on a sushi.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2013
comment: These are one of the better flavored sea weed snacks, but I'm concerned about a few of the ingredients, especially near the top is canola oil - unless it's organic, it comes from the genetically modified rape seed - there is really no such thing as 'canola' oil and i'm tired of the food manufactures intimating it is a healthy oil. NOT! People need to be educated about this non-food that truly can do you harm over time.also there is modified corn starch, also if not organic than most likely GMO based - Genetically Modified Organism - as is 90% of all corn and soy derived food stuffs in this country -unless stated as organic, youre likely on the losing end. And one more ingredient - maltodextrin -if you are gluten intolerant or sensitive or just want to cut gluten out of your diet, then you don't want this grain derived sweetener.  There are other seaweed snacks that have no additives and are not processed with questionable ingredients.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2017
comment: I purchase these at my local grocery store for a little over a dollar per pack. These are tissue paper thin rectangles of wasabi flavored crispy seaweed. I'm a salty snack addict and these are perfect for when you are trying to eat healthy and want something salty and crunchy. They kind of remind me of wasabi peas.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2011
comment_title: Good, but not something I'll buy again
comment: I've pretty much loved most of the Annie Chun line so I figured that I'd give the seaweed snacks a try. I figured that they would make for a nutritious & low calorie snack.The Good: The treats are very filling & while the serving size is about 10 pieces, you'll really only need a few in order to feel full. (I chalk that up to the sheer amount of nutrients there's supposed to be in seaweed.)The Bad: This stuff is so salty that you'll really only want to eat a few of these at a time. There's a little hint of a fishy flavor, but it's not strong enough to put me off of eating them.Overall these are decent enough to where I'll finish the rest of the bag, but I'm not thrilled enough with this to where I see myself buying more. This is sort of a "you like it or you don't" type of snack. I purchased the wasabi flavor as well, so perhaps I'll have better luck with those instead.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2017
comment_title: ... would I have thought I would be eating seaweed like potato chips
comment: Never would I have thought I would be eating seaweed like potato chips. I do like wasabi flavored almonds and chips, but never liked hand rolls. I bought these for a friend and kept almost all of them to myself. I am to the point where now I could eat plain ones.  Anyway, if you like wasabi you'd probably like these.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2019
comment: I just wish that these came in a bigger package, I never thought that I would ever love eating seaweed.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2014
comment: These are delicious, truly, and I can't begrudge the money I've spent on them because they made me realize how tasty and healthy seaweed can be.  These days, though, I find it much healthier, more economical and friendlier on the environment to just buy nori sheets and make them myself.  Brush nori sheets (the kind you make sushi with) with toasted sesame oil, spinkle a tiny amount of salt and then toast on a baking sheet in an oven at 225 degrees for about ten minutes until crispy.  Eeeeeeeasy, cheap, you control the ingredients and less packaging wastage.  I don't know how well these would store, mainly because I always gobble them down too quickly.  Low carb, calorie, and very tasty.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2014
comment: Annie Chun’s seaweed is so good, my daughter and I devoured an entire packages within minutes.  She’s tried seaweed before and didn’t care for it.  Now that she tried Annie Chun’s, her opinion has changed.  Seaweed is delicious.The seaweed is packaged so that the sheets stay whole.  No worries about little crumbs everywhere.  We get uniform, rectangular pieces.  They are lightly flavored, a little salty, but oh-so-good.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2012
comment: My wife and I love these and we had these on subscription, but they just got to be too expensive. Then we found similar snacks at one of the local Asian Grocery stores. They had products from several manufacturers, so we tried a bunch. They ALL basically tasted the same, so we now just buy the ones that are on sale. They are under $4.00 for 8 pack and 10 pack units (depending on the brand). THIS IS MUCH CHEAPER THAN THE PRICE OF THESE ON AMAZON. Since we eat these all the time, this is much more economical for us. My wife hates the "fresh" taste of fish, but she loves these, so I am surprised that people found them too "fishy".

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2017
comment: Yum! Satisfyingly crunchy, not too oily (but still enough that you have to wipe your hands.Also, not so dried out that you end up with flakes of seaweed everywhere.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2011
comment: I was looking for a healthy snack that was low in calories but really tasty.  These are delicious and full of flavor.  They are very light and only 30 calories for 1 serving (half the package).  If you happen to take a breath when putting one in your mouth, watch out because you will get a wasabi attack in your nostrils.  If you've ever had a little too much wasabi on your sushi, you'll know what I mean.  These are so tasty and the only bad thing about them is that when I eat them, I crave sushi.  These are very appetizing and I would recommend that you buy a single package first if you've never tried them.  If you've had nori snacks before and like the kick that wasabi gives you, you won't be dissapointed in these.  These are amazing.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
comment: I love seaweed snacks! These things are extremely addicting. Also, great alternative to traditional "unhealthy" snacks.It was quite different from regular seaweed snacks that I'm used to, but it was better than I expected. I think these are now my favorite seaweed snacks in the market. I'd definitely buy more once I run out.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2019
comment_title: Tastes and stinks like rotten fish!
comment: I tried one container of the sesame flavored, purchased locally.  The expiration date was Oct 31, 19.  BLICK!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2017
comment_title: I don't feel like each slice of seaweed should be soaked in glistening ...
comment: It's very oily. I don't feel like each slice of seaweed should be soaked in glistening grease for it to be enjoyable. I'm about halfway through my supply and I'm having trouble finishing it.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2015
comment_title: Wasabi is way better than Sesame
comment: I like the Wasabi! It's warm but not too hot. It's a nice addition to the seaweed, which is a satisfying and healthy snack.I'd previously had Annie's Sesame Seaweed. The Sesame version has too much oil & can get a bit messy. The Wasabi version doesn't have the oil, and I think it tastes better too.Winner!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2011
comment: These are so delicious!  I tried the Trader Joes ones on a road trip, and was so sad to not be able to buy them locally.  I found these at a local "dented box" store and tried them to see if they were just as good.  In my opinion, these are even better than Trader Joes!  They are a bit salty, but that is part of what I love about them.  I am so happy to have found a salty snack that I can feel good about eating, rather than guilty.  Even my three year old devours them!  So happy to have found them here for less than half of what I paid locally!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2011
comment: This very tasty but so salty.  10 thin sheets of seaweed = 70mg of sodium :(.  But I like that fact it has 35% of Vitamin A, and 6% of Vitamin C.  The package said that the seaweed was roasted with sesame oil but the ingredients listed as follow: seaweed, canola oil, sesame oil, and salt.  Well, canola oil is healthy as well.  I'll do more comparison w/ other roasted seaweed products to see if they are as tasty but lower in sodium.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2012
comment: I like it but most adults arent fond of it.  It tastes salty, sesame, a little green and a tiny bit of 'ocean' which is to say fishiness.  It has excellent nutritional characteristics and gives a good dose of vitamin A.  My 7 year old eats this like candy and so do a lot of his friends once he took some for his school snack.  I cant argue with him eating the equivalent of a handful of spinach every day.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2011
comment: I'd never tried flavored, roasted seaweed snacks before (however, do love seaweed and make our own sushi) but ordered both the Sesame and Wasabi due to low price and good reviews. Loved them! Love the Wasabi due to the Wasabi flavor/spiciness. The spiciness definitely adds up as you are eating them and will clear your sinuses after awhile but I think it's great! Love the Sesame due to the saltier flavor. I acknowledge I may be odd for that but I've always been a salt fan and these are so much better than chips! Only one of my co-workers was a fan but my BF loves them as well as one of his co-workers. Just ordered another case of each for us and his co-worker.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2014
comment_title: It seems like they're getting more expensive.  Maybe they're becoming more popular?
comment: I omnom these.  Mainly because I'm too lazy to buy regular nori and spray them down with PAM/Olive oil and sprinkle them with sea salt...Except... they're starting to get expensive.  At one point, these were $0.80 a pack.  Then $1.  Then $1.25.  They're tasty, but I think I'll start making my own, yanno?

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2016
comment: s far as seaweed goes these are good. I bought a case but got tired of them before I finished but it wasn't a loss.  Turns out my best friend's French bulldog loves them as treats.  Go figure. lol

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2012
comment: Just picked this up at Lassens Health Food Store and LOVE it! I gave my doggies a sample and they loved it too! Highly recommend. I dont think it's too salty as some other reviewers said, but I do like my food very flavorful. I really would be surprised by anyone not liking this. Plus, if It's good enough for model, Alessandra Ambrosia, then it's good enough for me (although not sure which seaweed snack she eats)!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2011
comment: I'd never tried flavored, roasted seaweed snacks before (however, do love seaweed and make our own sushi) but ordered both the Sesame and Wasabi due to low price and good reviews. Loved them! Love the Wasabi due to the Wasabi flavor/spiciness. The spiciness definitely adds up as you are eating them and will clear your sinuses after awhile but I think it's great! Love the Sesame due to the saltier flavor. I acknowledge I may be odd for that but I've always been a salt fan and these are so much better than chips! Only one of my co-workers was a fan but my BF loves them as well as one of his co-workers. Just ordered another case of each for us and his co-worker.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2011
comment: I bought these at the grocery store. Came to Amazon looking for a bulk buy. ;o)I didn't really know what to expect. These are very light and flaky--I wouldn't say crispy, exactly. They disintegrate as soon as they hit the moisture in your mouth, much like cotton candy does. They have a nice wasabi flavor, strong, but not so hot that it would prevent you from just downing the whole package at once. (Well, not for me anyway. But I am a bit of a wasabi addict.)That said, they are so ephemeral as to be unsatisfying. A better idea might be to wrap these around sushi rice for impromptu maki.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2012
comment_title: Perfect snack when I'm craving salt
comment: I keep my pantry stocked with these snacks.  At 60 calories a package, I can eat the whole thing (or even 2 or 3 of them) and not have blown my diet. When a friend told me about them, I thought, "I'm not sure if I like seaweed", but I tried them just so I could say I tried them.  They are so good.  The sesame oil really gives them a good flavor and they satisfy my salt cravings.  My husband loves them too. I can't believe he grabs them for a snack now too.  We're both eating healthier thanks to these snacks.You can find them at the health food stores in the Asian section (Walmart might even have them - I haven't looked in their Asian section).  That way you can try them before ordering a case.I like them so much that I have them ordered on automatic shipment now.  I tried other brands, but Annie Chun's is the best one by far.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2019
comment: Wasabi flavor great but seaweed wafer itself was not fresh.  Even neighborhood cats walked away from them.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2011
comment_title: Salty, Nutritious Snack for the family
comment: My kids, elementary and preschool aged, devour each package. They taste like extra thin, salty potato chips.  I absolutely hate the taste of fish and most seafood except shrimp and seaweed used for vegetarian sushi.  This snack does not remind me of fish at all.  I have not noticed any type of offensive smells and I am normally disgusted and lose my appetite around fishy smells.The best part is that these snacks are actually nutritious.  I like that we're getting a 1/3 of Vit A daily needs from them. It's really not that much salt (3% of DV) vs. a lot of processed foods that have much more salt per serving.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2012
comment: These sesame snacks are tasty and make a great low calorie snack.  I prepare a batch of sushi ingredients - parboiled carrots, cucumber slices, scrambled eggs with soy sauce and turbinado sugar, leftover salmon or shrimp - and wrap these around any of the ingredient along with brown sushi rice.  My favorite afternoon snack.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2011
comment_title: Im sure its healthy if you can get by the taste.
comment: I love wasabi sauce on my sushi and my sister made a great oriental seaweed salad for a hogroast last year that had me thinking this would be a product I would enjoy...  Well once you get past the slight amount of heat from the wasabi (sorry I eat habeneros so yes slight heat) it tasted like burnt rubber.  I brought the box into work from there and it sat for a couple months (within which time a couple people opened and tried 2 of the packages)  After that it made its way to the trash can as nobody wanted to eat it.I really am surprised by some of the reviews on here saying its delicious though...  Maybe I just got a bad pack, or maybe its a case of the shill...  Either way Ill stick with wasabi peas for a quick snack and just wait to get my seaweed fix with my sisters salad or at the local sushi bar piled with the nearly tear bringing wasabi they have there.

comment: These are the perfect width for sawing the sides of your mouth, each one digging deeper into the wound. -1 starThe amount of wasabi, as one review pointed out - varies from package to package. -1 star

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2011

comment:

   You can't beat the deal with S&S + Annie product discount.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2013
comment_title: Great Taste; Price and Packaging, Meh
comment: I only buy Annie Chun's Seaweed Snacks when they go on sale at my local coop. Of course, I understand complaining about price isn't fully Annie C's fall, as seaweed is expensive to harvest. But perhaps if they didn't use so much package, the price could come down. And include larger amts of seaweed in one package.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2013
comment: This product is cellophane thin.  I should have paid closer attention to the Net Weight -- .35 oz.  At the price advertised on Amazon that would be, without shipping and handling,  $15.29/12 =$1.27 per pack / .35 ounces = $3.63 per ounce.  For the nutritional value, one can buy food that is a lot more beneficial, for a lot less.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2012
comment: I didn't order these off amazon.com, I got my from Trader Joe's. When I first started eating, I noticed that they had more of a salt flavor and the wasabi is no joke. I liked them. They have more flavor than the Seasnax brand which is a factor I like. The only issue is that they do taste a tiny bit more fishy or ocean like. I was thinking of ordering a package but after reading some reviews about open package and spoiled product, I think I'll keep eating these as an occasional treat when I visit the fancy grocer.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2017

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2013
comment_title: Ph'nglui mglw'nafh Cthulhu R'lyeh wgah'nagl fhtagn
comment: I barely sleep at night-I hear his call.  He is calling me to the sea.  In the day I eat these-they remind me when I swam(when I swam?).. with the deep ones in the green swaying kelp.  I type this with great difficulty.  My hands are clumsily webbed.  I look in the mirror with horror at the visage staring back at me.  Tomorrow night I will swim with Loreli.  She also calls me, but today I will savour Annie Chun's Seaweed Snacks!  Ph'nglui mglw'nafh Cthulhu R'lyeh wgah'nagl fhtagn.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2011
comment: These things are amazing. I bought mine in a local health food store. They are a pack of extremely thin, spicy-HOT, slightly-crunchy seaweed rectangles. They're salty and very flavorful - with hardly any calories for the entire pack! If you don't mind the taste of kelp, and love salty and spicy food, try these. They help when you crave a small, salty snack. I devoured mine before I could try them on a turkey sandwich, so that'll be my next thing when I buy them again. Mmmmm.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2011
comment: These taste very much like the Trader Joe's and Sea's Gift brands.  The only difference is they are saltier.  Not sickening so but definitely noticeable.  I still like them but if given the choice, I would pick the less saltier brands only because I've gotten used to less sodium in my diet.  But to their credit, they are still tasty.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2014
comment: This is the perfect snack when you are wanting to watch what you eat, and not eat half a bag of chips when you're craving something salty and crunchy.  Not great for actually rolling with rice, but perfect for on the go snacks.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2014
comment_title: A little oily, a little funky, and a little light on the salt (for me anyway)...
comment: I guess you can never please all the people when it comes to salt, as some people here seem to think there's too much.  Maybe I just like salt, but compared to other seaweed/nori snacks I've had, these are particularly light and not salted enough for me.  That aside, I do like that they come in little wrapped cases to keep me from eating too many in one go.  But at the same time it seems a bit wasteful packaging-wise.  When I opened the individual package, the smell seemed a bit heavy and "off" compared to other seaweed snacks, but I figure seaweed can sometimes be like that and you just have to work around it knowing that it tastes better than it smells.  Also, due to the sesame oil, the inside of the packaging is a bit oily, which in turn gets your fingers a bit oily.  Overall, not bad as seaweed snacks go, but not great.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2012
comment: If you like it hot, then this is for you!  The seaweed taste is not overpowering.  The wafer is light and crispy.  I suggest if you open the package to eat them all that day, because they get less crisp the longer the package is open.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2012
comment: I think these snacks are insanely tasty and I love the green fresh-veggie taste mixed with that savory seafood flavor. These are addicting! Tried the sesame and the wasabi and definitely will buy more. Am scooping up last shreds of crunchy sea greens from bottom of package with my finger as I type this.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2013

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2011
comment: This is one of many varieties of seaweed snacks I've tried in my life. Most of them I get from the Japanese market, which also remain hit and miss.  This particular brand makes the seaweed snacks too potently flavored with wasabi.  The coating is uneven among several packages I've consumed.  In general, the wasabi dusting overpowers the seaweed and you lose track of the main product.Considering taste as well as value, I rank these are poor if you have local means to pick up some seaweed snacks.  If you aren't near an Asian market, these will do but I might try to find a non-wasabi version.  These are overpowering as well as a tad too salty for my taste.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2011
comment_title: snacks that you can't get enough of :D
comment: I don't like reviewing products to often but Annie chuns seaweed snacks are soooo good...i buy them in a bunch, but they don't last to long because I keep eating them :P their unique taste and slight crunch to it makes it the best snack ever...if you want to curb your appetite for chips, this snack is for you !!! if you think because its seaweed and it might not taste good, keep an open mind...you will love it!!! trust me, if my 12 year old nephew enjoys it (and he is finicky) so can you :) Just try it, you won't be disappointed!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2011
comment: I purchased these after I read that it was good for my thyroid (I have hypothyroid). comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2013
comment: These are one of the better flavored sea weed snacks, but I'm concerned about a few of the ingredients, especially near the top is canola oil - unless it's organic, it comes from the genetically modified rape seed - there is really no such thing as 'canola' oil and i'm tired of the food manufactures intimating it is a healthy oil. NOT! People need to be educated about this non-food that truly can do you harm over time.also there is modified corn starch, also if not organic than most likely GMO based - Genetically Modified Organism - as is 90% of all corn and soy derived food stuffs in this country -unless stated as organic, youre likely on the losing end. And one more ingredient - maltodextrin -if you are gluten intolerant or sensitive or just want to cut gluten out of your diet, then you don't want this grain derived sweetener. There are other seaweed snacks that have no additives and are not processed with questionable ingredients.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2014
comment_title: I feel as though I stuck a salmon head in mouth and attempted to suck the eyes from its sockets
comment: So a co-worker of mine made me a try one of these. Now I'll be honest, I'm not a person who typical eats food such as this and I typically pass the aisle of my local grocer containing these products without so much as a second look, but the offense that was assaulted on my body by eating one of these compelled me to write this review to save someone else from hours of suffering. It has been approximately 20 minutes since "the bite" and despite a bowl of apple cinnamon oatmeal and two cups of coffee and water I cannot erase the fish from the memory of my taste buds. I feel as though I stuck a salmon head in y mouth and attempted to suck the eyes from its sockets. Please for the love of God do not eat these.

I don't see me buying them again.

I'll stick with the non wasabi versions!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2011
comment: I first read about this product in First Magazine for Women. I knew roasted seaweed was very good for you, but these things are awful. First of all, they are very pricey; $1.19 per package. I picked them up at Whole Foods, because if I hated them, I would not be stuck with 14 bags. Anway, these things are just large seaweed sheets cut up in bit size and so spicy, you can't eat them. I expected them in a chunky chip, because the magazine touted them as a very filling snack. You could never get filled up with these thin things and the spice and salt are just too much. If you want something like this, just cut up the large sushi sheet seaweed and season; much cheaper.

But this seaweed snack that everyone is raving about is by far, bar none the nastiest bucket of yuck i have ever tasted in my entire life! it tastes like fermented ocean A**. Again i feel compelled to tell you the truth about this sea-garbage because every other review here is obviously someone who works for trader joe's and just trying to pitch the new product that they cant move off their shelves because there are no return customers. this seaweed snack has completely ruined my day and if it weren't for this beer in my hand to rid my tongue and nose of these rotting aromatics id probably take my own life just so that it would end. thank you for your time, and never buy this s***.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2019
comment_title: Stop deceiving us with misleading nutritional info!
comment: The ingredients list sugar and honey yet there is zero grams of sugar in a portion. How can that be?  A portions size is 5 grams and there are 36 portions in a bag so to figure out what a portion is you can either get a scale and weigh them to figure out how many are in 5 grams or  dump out the bag and make 36 piles and then count how many are in a pile This is deliberately deceiving because they don't want us to know what a portion size is.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2011
comment: These Lundberg Farms brown rice chips are the perfect crunchy, salty snack. I'm very health conscious and don't eat "snack foods" too often. But when I tried these wheat free, gluten free darlings... Yay! My favorite flavors are Fiesta Lime (which I served with homemade organic, grassfed chili) and the Sesame&Seaweed. But I've tried the Santa Fe BBQ as well and they are great. You won't be disappointed.*NOTE on price- These chips are around $2.69/bag but have steadily creeped up in price to well over $3 and change. Shop around. You shouldn't be paying more than $2 and change per bag or you're getting ripped off. And don't forget that many of these sites tack on shipping charges so you'll REALLY be paying too much. I like Vitacost. I've purchased products from them several times and they usually offer free shipping and many good deals. My things always arrive quickly too. Try them.Enjoy your new favorite snack! :)  Be well.

comment_author: Have Fun, Because It's Too Short!
comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2016
comment_title: I do NOT like healthy, but these are good!
comment: I am not a nutritionist, so not going to give you my view on the nutrition of the bars. See the ingredients photo attached for details!What I am sharing my opinion on are they real key factors. How it feels, how it chews, how it taste, how it sits in the stomach and how it poops out. For the record, on a scale of 1-10, 10 being best score, I rate me a 1 when it comes to desire to eat healthy and an 8 at actually eating healthy. In fact, right now I am thinking cheesecake and not a healthy snack bar.PACKAGING – Score 9When it comes to the packaging, I find the package is easy to open, even after sitting in my back pocket before a 10 mile run. The bar is always cleanly in the packaging, not sticking too much too it. I have never had a struggle or frustration taking the food out of the package, an experience you always have with sugar daddy’s (of course, my pre-healthy days only).The package is sealed well and keeps the food tasting fresh.CHEW EFFECT – Score 9I like the texture. Once placed in the mouth, the heavens open up, doves flew out and WAM. Okay, maybe that does not happen, but the texture of the food is solid. It is not too hard or too chewy. When you’re done eating, the food is not crammed between teeth cracks or sticking to the top of the mouth.TASTE – Score 10Awesome. Perfect flavor. Not too sweet.SWALLOW EFFECT – Score 10Good. Repeat and it works great.STOMACH ACCEPTANCE – Score 10Simply awesome. My stomach when it comes to sensitivity is extremely high. If I eat items with too much sugar, my stomach turns. The bars sat well.  They do not sit heavy and they digest well. I never have an issue where gas is leaking out of me (or at least where I can blame it on the bars), so my digestive system pushes it a long well. I am sensitive to gluten, but still no issues.TOILET APPROVED – Score 10This part ended quick, fast and smooth. One big splash finished nature’s course and it was a blessing since lactose issues are normal for me.FAMILY APPROVED – Score 10Wife and Kids love them. Wife loves them because they are easy to store and pull when needed!FINAL COMMENTSGreat product, great flavor. If you are on the fence, try them, you will be impressed.Let me know if the review was helpful!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2018
comment_title: Great no sugar added fruit snack for all ages
comment: I like these for several reasons, the first being there's no added sugar. If you've every tried to find a fruit type snack that doesn't have a ton of added sugar, you know there's not many options available. These are great because they're made with only fruit, they won't melt or freeze if I leave them in my car, awesome snack for when my blood sugar drops and I need a quick snack, and the kids I nanny for love them as well so I always keep extras in my purse. I love the organic ones but they're pretty pricey but these are certified non-GMO so that's a second best winner for me and the price is good for the amount you get.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2018
comment_title: Delicious, healthy and convenient snack! A real fruit serving.
comment: Delicious! Great snack to grab and go for kids or adults. No added sugar or corn syrup! It is just pureed fruit. Since fruit can go bad or get bruised en route, these are an easy form to bring on outings or camping. Keep a few on hand for when the neighbor kids come over. Easy to fit in a purse, backpack, sports bag or lunch. Healthier than chips, candy and pop for kids. My family loves the variety of flavors. They are even mom-approved. At only 50 calories, they are easy to pair with a cheese stick or veggies for a larger snack.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2018
comment: These are really tasty, especially the strawberry and raspberry flavors. The price Is reasonable. They’re a little chewy but won’t tug on your teeth or fillings. I stick these in my purse for when I need a snack or my sugar level gets low. I’m Not a diabetic, I just don’t eat breakfast and don’t always have time to stop for food so these work good for me. I recommend them.Only negative comment I have is that some of them are a little dried out. I haven’t finished the box yet. I’ve probably ate 20 of them so far. 3-4 were dried out.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2015
comment: I like these, it's a good option for lunch boxes or for being on the go with the kids.  They take no room at all so I often have a few in my purse too just in case I am stuck somewhere and the kids need a little something to eat.  I have purchased this I don't even know how many times and I can say that it's usually very good but sometimes some flavors are very rough and chewy, as if they were an old batch or something.  Other than that, it's pretty good and good value.  My local supermarket carries these individually and they can even go for $1 each and the least they charge is 2 for $1, so either way this has worked out very well for me.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2018
comment_title: Tasty all fruit fruit snack option
comment: **Update: Since my review the company changed the packaging and apparently the recipe on these (the change was quite awhile back). I now find the Cherry flavor to be inedible (luckily hubby eats them!) and Apple to be one of my favorites. Still worth buying and eating 🙂Old review: I was looking for a fruit snack made entirely of fruit, with no added sugar, and discovered these fruit strips. This package contains 6 different flavors, of which Apple is my least favorite and Cherry or Grape are my most. Yes, these are still processed fruit snacks, but, they're better than gummy bears (what I'm using them to replace), and with this brand you're eating actual fruit, not fruit flavors mixed with high fructose corn syrup. And that's a definite win!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2018
comment: I LOVE nuts and this trail mix looked really good!! And the bag shows all the right things... "no artificial ingredients", "omega 3", "non GMO", "gluten free", "vegan"... I don't understand why companies do this... fruit is already sweet. :-( Nice idea and good price but for that reason I won't be reordering. I'll find an all natural alternative.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2018
comment: This mix is quite tasty. However, I would say 10-15% of the almonds in each bag are rancid, and a smaller portion of the walnuts as well. This is disappointing, as this mix is otherwise quite good. I've had rancid almonds in multiple bags now, so this was not isolated to one or two.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2019
comment: I should probably be ashamed but...oh well. I bought this for my squirrels and birds. I enjoy watching the wild and silly antics of squirrels in my backyard. Peanuts and corn aren't the best food options for squirrels so I wanted an assortment of tree nuts and seeds for their treats (they also get mixed nuts in shells). Our "neighborhood" was hundreds of acres 100+ yr old forest until a year ago so I wanted to give the squirrels and birds a little something extra. They all seem to live this mix.I suspect my husband and teenage son may eat some of this trail mix from time to time as well but haven't commented on the flavor since they don't want to admit to eating my squirrel treats. :-D

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2019
comment: Trail mix was good, however one of the packs had numerous rocks mixed in the dried cherries. I called and emailed the company, but never heard a response.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2018
comment_title: Fruit fruit fruit and more fruit and then some nuts
comment: The fruits were tasty enough but there was way too much fruit for it to be a nut product.Fruits also appear to be Sweetened, not natural.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2019
comment_title: It’s good but waaaay too many cranberries!
comment: I used to buy these from my local store ALL the time! I was addicted to the stuff. I’m not sure if the composition has changed or maybe I’m just realizing it now but 70% of the bag is cranberries! I made that number up but it’s ALOT of cranberries and it makes the entire mix sickeningly sweet.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2019
comment_title: Delicious but could use more nuts
comment: This mix is sooooo tasty! I buy two bags of this a month to have a healthy and tasty snack to eat at work. I love all of the ingredients here and they all work well together. I wish there was a higher concentration of nuts in here to give it a little less sugar and make it more filling but I'll usually just add more nuts to the mix on my own.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2018
comment: I bought 3 bags along with 2 protein packed trail mixes.  The protein packed has a date stamped on the bottom of 10/09/19 and tasted fresh.  The omega packs has no date anywhere on the bags that I could find.  They smell oily and nuts tasted old.UPDATE:  I reordered and still no date on bags.  Good thing though that these bags taste great with so much fresher ingredients.  Changed my rating to 4 stars from previous 1.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2019
comment: I really like this mix. I have tried alot of varieties and this one is my favorite so far. It has all the blends I like, walnuts, almonds, cranberries and more. I like it even more because the dried fruits are tasty and not bland like others. Love it. Will be ordering more.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2019
comment_title: The whole mix is great, but the chocolate makes it worth ordering.
comment: I think this is a fantastic price for such a great trail mix.We initially had this on a plane when we were flying home from Cozumel. I thought maybe it was the travel fatigue, and the increasing hunger pangs due to flying through lunch, that made the chocolate in this taste so good at the time. The obvious next logical step was to hunt it down on Amazon, in order to test out the flavor more scientifically in the comfort of my own home.It turns out the chocolate chunks really are that good. Everything else is good too! But the chocolate is the real star here.In conclusion, maybe order it and pick out all the chocolate pieces and then pour the rest into a ziplock bag and be like "look at this trail mix I made!" and your family will be none the wiser and they'll be happy you got them a delicious trail mix, and you'll be happy to have the chocolate pieces hidden away for the days when you need to eat hidden away chocolate.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2018
comment_title: I have a complaint. I just opened my second ...
comment: I have a complaint. I just opened my second  package of 8 ct. eatsmart snacks. 3 out of 8 individual packages had 1 to 5 chips in them! The packaging system must have gone nuts. I opened 3 bags and got 11 chips. They did not total even 1 normal package.  Those 3 bags were rather costly!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2018
comment_title: This is how they stack up to the big brands....
comment: The main ingredient is potato, so these are essentially just chips. They are baked instead of fried, which helps keep the calories down. A little bland, but OK.For anyone curious, a regular bag of plain Lays chips is right around 6 calories per gram, plain Lays baked chips are 4 calories per gram, whereas these are only 2.13 calories per gram.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2016
comment: oh my goodness. I have been looking for chip-like snacks that are a little less unhealthy and I think I have found them in these. This is THE BEST way to get my guys to eat tomatoes (they won't eat them in any food or by themselves, so in chip form is all I can do) and spinach when they think they are getting an unhealthy snack, they are actually getting a little bit of nutrients.These are in nice 100 calorie bags which make them super convenient for quick snacks or for adding to a lunch box for school or work.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2019
comment_title: Low in calories and fat but the taste is meh.
comment: I bought these Eatsmart Snacks Veggie Crisps as a substitute for regular potato chips which are so high in fat and calories. I like the small portion controlled bags and the chips stay fresher longer bagged in small quantities. The taste is OK but not great. My sister thinks they are awful and my husband says they are bland. Honestly, no one I know likes them but me. And I don't like them like I do other lower fat/calorie chip products..I even like veggie straws better.They're not like my beloved Pringles or Ruffles or even baked chips but they have the crunch, the saltiness, and a decent flavor, They serve the purpose of having a crunchy chip but I don't crave them or choose them over other similar products. I won't buy them often but they do come in handy when I want a salty snack but don't want to indulge in potato chips.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2017
comment: I love these chips! This package comes with 8 backs of 100 calorie bags of chips and it's a decent portion. I eat them with 1-2 tablespoons of hummus, a triangle of the soft laughing cow cheese, or salsa but they're tasty on their own too. If you wanted to save some money you could probably buy a big bag a a grocery store and portion into little zip lock bags yourself but these are just so quick and easy to grab that I can't help buying them!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2019
comment: Very delicious. Has a great crisp! It satisfies that potato chip craving. It came well packaged. Unlike a small bag of potato chips, there's actually a decent amount per serving bag! comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2016
comment: I love veggie straws but have become hooked on these as well.  They're shaped more like a traditional chip and have a decent flavor without the grease or guilt. These 100 calorie packs are perfect to grab in the morning for a snack or part of your lunch.  When I'm wanting a little extra with them, I dip them in hummus and it's delicious.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2017

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2017
comment_title: ... to have a real taste for the sea to love this.
comment: You have to have a real taste for the sea to love this...Seaweed is good for the iodine it provides, helps move your bowls and over all, is good for your health.  I eat it directly from the pack, but it's excellent with smoked salmon and light cream cheese spread on it or in Asian style soups....Yum!  The one bad thing is it will turn your breath fouler than anything...it's indescribable, so be sure to brush your teeth, gums and tongue (especially the back of your tongue)...and then repeat it again...SERIOUSLY, you do not want to talk closely with anyone after eating this or you will forever leave a bad impression!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2013

comment: This is now the second brand of seaweed snacks that i've tried.I had held onto an empty package of "Sea Veggies[tm]" that i purchased from a local Kroger's store for *months*, telling myself if i ever get to that Kroger's again i'll need to buy more of these 'cause they're a great snack...  Eventually i went online and that particular brand seemed too expensive in bulk so i went with this Trader Joe's version.  Honestly, i can't tell them apart (though admittedly it's best a few months or more since i had that competing brand).When i finish the last of these i'll move on to another brand and review those, too.  ^_^

It has the healthy /meaning green and fishy taste. I teach health and wellness and do not always eat things for there taste but for energy . The little bag is filling and certainly helps me not to crave potato chips and sweets. I am really pleased. Right now my review is a 4, I would not be surprised If I write one with a 5 later. comment: "Blub blub blub blub. Blub blub - blub. Blub." - Pinot the Goldfish

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2012
comment: If you love sushi, you'll also love these seaweed snacks.  They are my new favorite low-carb snack, and perfect for when I feel like munching on something (like when I'm watching a movie).  I have type 1 diabetes, and have to watch my carb intake.  I consider these snacks to be a "free food" as they do not impact my blood sugar, and I do not need to take any insulin when I eat it. The ones I ordered did not have a wasabi taste to them, but a nice, pleasant, lightly roasted sesame taste.  They melt in your mouth and are a healthier alternative to chips, nuts, or popcorn when you need a little snack.I don't have a Trader Joe's where I live, so I'm glad I can order these from Amazon.  I will definitely be ordering more! :-)

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2013
comment: Trader Joe's Roasted Seaweed Snacks are delicious.  I crave them the way most people crave potato chips.  They're low in calories (60 calories for the entire package) and contain beneficial minerals that you might not get elsewhere, so you can eat a ton of them without feeling guilty.  It's an excellent product.The problem was that these were shipped in a bag, not a box.  This would be fine if the plastic box inside the wrapping were rigid, but it's not.  Every box was flattened at some point during shipping.  Seaweed snacks don't really bend without breaking.  Everything was broken into little shards that drifted around the inside of the package during shipping, so when I went to open one of the packages, the seaweed on the outside of its container got all over the place.  Since these are made with oil, it's very hard to get little bits off of a surface.  Eating them without making a mess was equally difficult.  You'd think for $5 shipping the sellers would at least make sure the product made it to the buyer in one piece.  I wish they had taken the care to use a box rather than a bag.  What I really wish was that I'd just made the trip to Trader Joe's and bought them there.  I'm very disappointed.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2011
comment: This salty, savory gem is so satisfying.  Packaged in an airtight container, it is as fresh and crisp as the moment it was packed at the factory.  Each package has only 60 calories--and that's for two servings!  The seaweed comes in thin, rectangular sheets of a beautiful shade of green.  As you take a bite, the crisp sheet reminds you of biting into a potato chip or popcorn--crunch and a bit of salt.  Once on your tongue, it begins to dissolve, giving you a more gelatinous texture.  If you enjoy Japanese foods such as sushi, this is for you.What a great, low calorie alternative to take to the movies.  Or, to lunch, to eat at your desk, in the car, at sports events, on the plane.  Easy to handle, small, crunchy, salty, chewy.  M-m-m, just plain yummy.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2018
comment: I love roasted seaweed snacks. I have purchased these directly from a Trader Joe's store. This brand is on the bland and flimsy side of the seaweed snack spectrum, but they are tasty enough. The upside of seaweed snacks for me is the iodine content. If you've never tried seaweed snacks before, they may be an acquired taste. The downside is that they are made with canola oil which is unhealthy because it inhibits enzyme function among other effects. There are other brands which are canola-free. Had these been canola-free, I could only wish that the people who dumped theirs in the trash would have sent them my way. Based on that fact that there are seaweed snacks with healthier ingredients, I won't be buying these again. In fact, I will try making them at home with a recipe found in my search for canola-free snacks. If you do eat these, you may experience digestive upsets if you consume more than a few at a time. I don't know if it's because of the canola oil or if it's seaweed-related, but this seems to be a common side effect.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2015
comment_title: Great for hypothyroid .. DOES NOT contribute to acne & Good price & Taste great
comment: At first I gave this a low-rating, since I thought it contributed to my kid's acne.  After 1 year of using this, I upgrade to 5-stars.  It has zero effect on my teenager's acne, but helps her hypothyroid, since Kelp has iodine, necessary for thyroid function.  This product also has 8% vitamin A (helps with skin & thyroid), plus 20% vitamin C, and 2% iron.  One pack has only 30 calories, and only 99 cents at Trader's Joe.I notice that I nap easier when I snack on this for breakfast.  I appreciate this product for is low-cost, low-calories, and how it helps my teenager daughter with her hypothyroid .. her skin is clear, despite having one pack per day.  Seaweed has minerals:  iodine, potassium, magnesium, calcium and iron.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2013
comment_title: Delicious but don't pay more than you should!
comment: These are amazingly delicious and addictive! But they are only 0.99 cents in the store...why overpay??? They should be just over $5 for 6 packs....someone is ripping you off if you pay double!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2016
comment_title: Too much packaging but tastes great
comment: These taste great and are nutritious -- my 9 year old son who won't eat anything but meat and junk food (chips, french fries, etc) loves them. Here is my complaint: the packaging creates a LOT of waste. I try to get him to cut up the plastic--its bulky and takes up a lot of space in the trash can/recycle bin. And the outer wrapping does not ball up well either. I am looking for a company that packages theirs differently but is as economical and tasty as this. Anyone know of one?

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2014
comment: These seaweed snacks are definitely not for everyone, but worth trying.  If you like sushi then you will recognize the flavor of the wrapper.  My daughter and I picked some up just to try, then we were both trying not to eat them all.  They are so good!  They are crunchy, crispy and very flavorful.  They aren't too salty either.  I don't like salty foods.  The sesame oil added the perfect touch of flavor to put them over the top.  My husband also thought that they were okay, but he wasn't crazy about the thin paper-like consistency.  That texture is what I thinks makes them great for a healthy snack.  You don't need to eat a lot to get the flavors.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2012
comment: I'm no vegetarian, and am certainly not a "granola girl," yet I find these so amazingly tasty! There's just a moderately salty crunch at first, and then they basically "melt in your mouth." The flavor is exactly like the seaweed wrapped around sushi rolls; no "fishy" taste.Like other reviewers, I initially decided to try these because (1) they're crazy-low in calories, and (2) I'd heard about how healthy seaweed is. So glad I did! These - remarkably - satisfy my husband's salty-crunchy cravings, so we don't buy any potato chips/tortilla chips/pretzels/popcorn anymore!I really wanted to dock a star for (1) wanting to eat more than are in each package (aka: the package is too small), and (2) because they're pretty pricey compared to other salty-crunchy snacks. But, I just couldn't do it. They are too darn delicious! I would buy these in bulk at Sam's Club if I could!Side note: I haven't done any research on the health benefits of dried v. fresh seaweed. I suspect that fresh has many more vitamins/nutrients, but that's purely my own speculation. If anyone has any info on this...please comment on my review so I can take a look. Thanks!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2016
comment: I get these from trader joes. I had them a few years ago and HATED them!!! Thought they were nasty! Fast forward to now. I am eating a low carb diet and wanted a snack so I bought some knowing my husband likes them so if I hated them again it wouldn't go to waste. I tried one... ugh... yuck. Tried it once more and then I was hooked. Now I am lucky if I don't eat a whole package.  It is an acquired taste. So you really can't judge by the reviews. I once hated them now I love them.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2012
comment_title: If heaven came in a bag ...
comment: It would be called Trader Joe's Roasted Seaweed Snack.These dried pieces of seaweed are lightly coated in sesame oil and salt for a crisp, delicious snack. I'd never tried roasted seaweed before but I decided to give them a try. Needless to say, I now consider myself a seaweed addict.Seaweed has many healthy things in it that we most likely don't get from other sources of food we eat. The best thing about this snack is that you can eat the whole bag (and trust me, you will) and it's only 60 calories.You will pay a lot lower price if you buy it in the store rather than from Amazon. Not everyone has a local store to them so at least you have somewhere to buy this yummy treat!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2012
comment_title: Try Them! Healthy, Low Calorie, Yummy Treat
comment: I've been trying new things I wouldn't ordinarily even think of trying because they're healthy for me. My initial reaction wasnot so great, but I could deal with eating them because they're good for me.  So days later, had more....okay I could deal with them a little better.Then, days later I realized I was sitting at my computer & just popping them into my mouth & I was REALLY LIKING THEM A LOT.  Only 60 calories for the whole package.  They are flakey, lightly crunchy, & lightly salty in tast.  Sure beats having potato chips.  I went to trader joes & purchased 15 boxes for 99 cents each box just to make sure they're in the house when I get the munchies.Definitely try them & give them a chance...

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2011
comment: It's suspicious when it's 8pm, rainy, and I'm contemplatinga run to Trader Joes for seaweed... Are we so sure it's onlyseaweed and salt?  Whatever it is I LOVE IT. Great snackwith very little guilt attached.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2012
comment: This review is going to sound very different from a normal one.First off, I would like to point out that yes, I gave it four stars on purpose.  Please keep that in mind and read this very thoroughly.I hate these snacks.  I hate them because they are so insanely addictive, I find it nearly impossible to "just have one."  Invariably, I end up consuming the entire package grinning like a giddy schoolchild.  Even if I put them away, I will inevitably find myself searching the package out, just so I can have one more.. and then again, and again, until the package is finally empty, and then I am sad.I hate them because of their fun, paper-thin texture, which makes it seem like you've some piece of unique candy, then it turns out to be a delicious, slightly salty, somewhat chewy snack which makes your brain scream 'Oooh, yay, SUSHI!' only for it to suddenly turn nutty in a twist which makes me want to have just one more to experience that fun crinkle of the sheets (for they are super-thin sheets of dried, roasted seaweed), the YAY of incoming sushi, that slightly chewy transformation, and then they dissolve into almost nothingness, leaving you reaching for another one.I hate them because the pack lasts about 45 minutes.  An hour and a half, if I'm demonstrating exceptionally strong willpower for the day.  Possibly longer if I can manage to convince someone *else* to hide them from me.I hate them because said pack gives me 40% of my Vitamin C for the day in less than half an ounce of actual dried seaweed.  And something that tastes so very delicious isn't supposed to be that healthy.  Bacon doesn't give vitamin C.  These snacks do.  That's confusing.  Snacks are supposed to be guilty pleasures, not delightful dietary supplements.I hate them because the only physical store that carries them in my area is Trader Joe's, and I always end up opening the pack after they are closed.  So when the package is empty and I am sad, I must wait until morning to "get my fix" again.I hate them because I ate an entire package while writing this review.  And now it is gone.  And now I am sad.  Thankfully, though, I can get them here and have them delivered to my door.  I might have to order a few of the six packs, though, to last me until the next order I place can arrive.  I'm working out a rationing calendar that I probably won't stick to for more than an hour.And finally, I hate that I don't hate these at all, but am hopelessly and utterly addicted to them.  Seaweed Anonymous, thou art my name.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2012
comment: just a nice snack to munch on. it doesn't have a lot of calories and it's very light and crispy. trader joe's sells them for only 99 cents a pack so you can't beat the price!
