comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2014
comment: Yuck!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2012
comment_title: Like going down on a dead horseshoe crab
comment: I gave it two stars cause my friend likes it and she smarter than me. When she asked me to try it, my face puckered.  It's possible that the taste was tainted (pun intended) by a trader joes dark chocolate/powerberry/dingleberry, but I'll be sticking to the chili lime cashews and wasabi almonds from now on.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2012
comment: I received a package of Trader Joe's Roasted Seaweed Snack for my 23rd birthday. Growing up deeply entrenched in Asian cuisine, I knew before trying it that it was more than likely not going to be to my tastes. If you like products such as grass jelly or sushi, or anything that is pungent and tastes like plant material without being om nom nom delicious, this is for you.This product is not recommended for small children. There's not enough sugar in it.This product is also not recommended for vegans and seliacs. While it is gluten free and animal-product free, you can do something better for yourselves by finding an alternative snack without the bay water flavor.This product is not recommended for people with heart disease or who are at risk for developing heart disease. It's a high sodium choice.This product is not recommended for alcoholics. You'll start drinking again.This product is not recommended for cigarette smokers. Save your money for your cancer sticks.This product IS recommended for users of Mountain Dew, grass or ai ju jelly, pickled radish, bean thread, sushi, menudo, mole sauce, adobo sauce, specialty bell peppers, bouncy balls, pencil and pen erasers, rubber soles, rubber in general, motor oil, gasoline/petrol, radioactive isotopes, unidentified rare earth metals, tapeworms, Buffalo Bills fans, fruit cake, Hostess snacks, corn, rat, and/or chicken snakes, parents of teenagers (for use as a punishment agent on those late night sneak outs), water bottles, organic milk, Tuscan Whole Milk, Three Wolf Moon shirts, wolf shirts in general, Twilight readers, and insomniacs.The flavor matches wonderfully with a fresh whole rabbit, such as the one listed on this site.I would rate it higher than two stars in the regards that it's a wonderful seaweed product. However, I don't like it. That's the definition of two stars.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2013
comment: Great snack, I could eat all 6 packs at one sitting. Not too salty, taste just right. (3 more words required)

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2019
comment: Snacks. Kids love it.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2016
comment: I thought these chips would be weird, but I LOVE them!! They're very ranch-y and delicious. I'd very gladly eat more of these!!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2018
comment: When I have purchased Terra sea salt vegetable chips from the local stores, they have always tasted great, but this online purchase left me with a bad taste in my mouth, (no pun intended). Firstly, the 24 pack of chips arrived with an  eight day expiration date!! On past performance, I really like these chips, but I don't think we'd be eating 24 bags in a little more than a week! Secondly, EVERY BAG TASTED BAD! Chips tasted stale, were chewy and indigestable, and frankly had a rank "off"  taste. NONE of the bags we opened were crispy. Thirdly, I sent them back to Amazon, and received a replacement box of Terra Chips. These chips do taste marginally better,  and are within sell-by date, but for some reason do not have the fresh taste we are used to experiencing from  Terra Chips purchased from our local grocery store. The batch tastes stale and so we threw them out as it is too much hassle to go through the hassle of having to have them replaced AGAIN, Won't be purchasing again..

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2019
comment: I have been eating and enjoying these chips for over 15 years.  Sometimes, I would get a bag of stale chips that tasted like cardboard, but this would occur infrequently.  Over the last year, the chip quality started to change radically with entire batches of 24 bags of chips being stale or impossible to eat because they were too hard.  My last three orders consisted of one batch of cardboard chips and two batches of rock chips.  Unfortunately, I have decided never to order these chips again because I have no idea what I will get.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2019
comment: I'm not sure why these were even shipped with a pull date of 12/17 but this is not acceptable.  The chips were stale and bad tasting.  I just can't believe these were even shipped.  Someone didn't do their job and this fell shot.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2017
comment: As I said, I LOVE these chips. They are absolutely delicious. However, this is the second time that I have opened a bag that had less than 1/5 full of chips, brand new! I shrugged it off the first time, but now I feel somewhat jilted. These chips aren't the cheapest ones around, and I have them on a subscription. I hope they can improve their QC. I'm afraid if I find bag # 3 like this that I will have to spend my money elsewhere.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2015
comment_title: to my great disappointment, there seems to be something very wrong ...
comment: After I ran out of the previous terra chips I had ordered, I tore into my new box of individually packaged Terra chips.  However, to my great disappointment, there seems to be something very wrong with this order...none of the bags has a notch with which to tear it open (requiring scissors, my teeth, whatever is around to even get into them) and then so far, each of the 3 bags I've opened is stale!  They are all well before their expiration date and tightly sealed as far as I can tell.  Additionally, they are kept in a temperature controlled area of my home so in my opinion they arrived this way.  Very disappointed and I'm past the date to be able to return them per Amazon...so I'm stuck with a large box of stale chips!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2020
comment: I love these chips when they are fresh. I always look for them at airport shops when I travel. In fact, I could say I am slightly addicted to them. So I ordered these and they arrived very quickly. However, upon trying a packet, they had a very nasty stale taste. I know how these should taste as I have, over the past 10 years purchased many from supermarkets. So when I got this package, I could wait to try a pack. They tasted so bad I had to spit out what was in my mouth. The label said use before June 8, 2020, but all I can say is that maybe these wont poison me but they tasted terrible anyway.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
comment: This is a reliable product with great taste, flavor and texture. I ordered and returned one box due to rancid taste (bad oil in frying or improper storage) and received prompt replacement from Amazon. Unfortunately the replacement was the same batch and expiration date, and tasted the same, rancid. But Amazon would not accept a return (their bot is so structured) and I have to dispose of two unusable boxes and eat the expense. Please do not buy lots with April 20 expiration since they may be an entire lot with the same problem. Hoping that a real human will read this at Amazon and rectify the problem.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2018
comment_title: Description said blue chips but got mixed flavors in last order 🤨
comment: First, I think these are an excellent product but I have to mention that when I last ordered through Subscribe & Save, I received a box that also contained Regular and Sweet Potato.  The description never mentioned anything but the blue chips. There were also multiple bags containing soggy chips. Umm yuck!The product itself is delicious. It doesn't taste like most of the over processed junk out there. My 9 year old daughter loves the blue chips and I don't feel badly packing a bag for school snack. They can be a bit pricey but Amazon offers a pretty good deal. I'm just leery after my last experience.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2016
comment_title: Wise choice for people who need to count on calories
comment:
So far the best potato chip I ever had. It's crispy yet without traditional oil frying. It has incredibly low calories compared to regular potato chips which I like. When you think about snack chips available in the market, you can't really find something that is "healthier choice" but Terra Chips give you variety option of baked chip without the trans fats, real vegetables, with no sodium option. It has over 25 different varieties available.Nice thing about this chips are it comes with smaller package which is about 28 grams while other regular brand chips come with 50 grams. I have tried original recipe, sweet potatoes, taro, and my favorite blue potatoes. Unlike real veggies, it will come with all the calories and fat of a regular chip but with healthier version. It has a line of no-added salt version which is good to manage their sodium level.Packaging was superior, all of my 24 chips come in one box without scattered pieces. I can't wait to try different varieties when they have more promotional sale.Tip: Price changes constantly, just monitor the price to grab a best deal.

TERRA Blues, Sea Salt, 1 Ounce (Pack of 24)

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2015
comment_title: Need to find them in larger sizes
comment: Had these on JetBlue a couple of times and was hooked. I looked at several health food stores for them and came up empty-handed, although they had Terra brand chips.  I wonder why this flavor are so hard to find.  The small bags may be fine as a free snack on an airplane, but it felt wasteful as a snack at home.  All the little bags.  One is never enough and you reach for another. And another.  I felt like I was paying more for air than for chips.  The chips were generally delicious, but some bags had chips that seemed stale and more tough than what I had on JetBlue.  But next time I'm hunting for these chips, I will want to find them in regular size bags.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2019
comment_title: If you have a problem with textures of food, you probably won't like things like these.
comment: I'm not going to give it a 1 star because this is more preference based. Imagine eating something thinner than paper, it was gross.I'm sensitive to certain things though, apple skin, grape skin, corn, or oranges, I just cant get them down and have a chewed up piece of something I want to spit out.This product isn't like the above where I can't chew it, but it was like trying to eat rolling paper or thin wax paper you'd use for presentations. You can bite it off easy, but it's so thin it feels weird to attempt to chew. I don't know how some people can do it.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2019
comment: I love Kirkland roasted sea weed from Costco. They are crispy with a slight salty taste. I used to eat one or two servings everyday. But recently Costco no longer carry them anymore. So I found them on Amazon and ordered one bag with 8 packs in it. What a fake! The bag wrapping is apparently hand-made. The aluminum wrapping looks genuine. But the plastic containers in it are all deformed. The seaweeds are stale and tasteless. Oh, did I mention the price is twice I paid at Costco warehouse? I am positive this is a fraudulent product. Costco and Amazon  needs to investigate this crime! I threw away the rest of it for safety reasons.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2020
comment_title: Bought It At Costco When In Stock & 50 Flakes Not 5 Flakes & Only $9.88.
comment: This a great Product that comes full Packaged Protecting the 50 Roasted Flakes per 10 Packages that are also wrapped in 1 Bundle.  Perfect to replace Potato Chips as snake, put on Fish Sandwiches, Shrimp Salads, Pizza and any Fish Sui-chi Dish making all crunchy when biting into them. Adds great flavor as well.  Lately, it has been hit or miss at Costco, sometimes have them, then sold out. Amazon deliveries are just great as well if they will match the price and quantity.  I know the seaweed is sold in different flavors but i can't tell the difference just a great ocean taste. Highly recommend the product and is a big hit at parties or serving with other dishes for guests. One is wary at first look and bite but try a few and you won't by Potatoes Chips for a long time.  Total fat 1.5 Grams with 1 Gram of Protein per 20 Flakes servings. Zero Saturated or Trans Fats, Carbs, or Sugars either. Does come with 40 mg salt but high in Iron and Potassium and good for Thyroid as some studies have shown on Seaweed Ingredients, Vitamins and Benefits.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2018
comment_title: The crackers have a great taste, but.....
comment: Update 7/26/20 - After continued shipping problems with the crackers always arriving as mostly crumbs and several phone calls to Amazon complaining about it, we have decided to stop ordering this product. Amazon now sells a similar cracker that's just as tasty but ships in a solid plastic container which provides much better protection than the mylar bag of this cracker. I knocked a star off my original review as we are still dealing with this TWO YEARS LATER. It's an unfortunate situation because these are otherwise very delicious crackers that are marred and tainted only by its packaging and shipping practices.We order these in the flexible mylar bag. The crackers have a great taste and are a favorite of our family. Unfortunately, we always receive these with nearly half of the crackers crushed because they are shipped in a soft, flexible envelope packaging. Order at your own risk.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2019
comment: I didn't start out looking for these, but was real glad I did!  I've enjoyed these crackers since I was a kid.  I had a neighbor who was Japanese and introduced me to a lot of fun snacks.  These can be hard to find, depending on where you live, at least good ones.  So after looking at some of the offerings and the prices on Amazon I settled on giving these and the Asia Trans Co. a try.These have wonderful deep soy sauce flavor and color.  And many others I've tried just pale in comparison, seriously, they're a very light color or actually white and there's very little taste.Beware - This particular brand of arare  contain MSG.  So those of you who freak out about this ingredient or are sensitive to it - stay away.The bag came full to the brim in its own resealable bag. The bag itself is pretty thick and I hope the seal is tight enough to keep them fresh.  Nothing worse than getting some of these and the next day or two and they're stale.  In comparing these to the Asia Trans brand, I find these to have a better flavor; that's probably the addition on the msg, but I'll take it.The two bags came in a single box, without  paper or plastic bubble packs so they wouldn't bang around and break into cracker dust.  So I was surprised to find that they're mostly intact.  I poured some in a bowl, tried to get pieces from the bottom as well.  You can see that there are not a lot of broken pieces despite there not being any padding. I also put some on the paper with a bottle cap to show scale, since these are not very large.  I also included a picture of the expiration date, a little over eight months from now.Overall, I'm very satisfied with these and would buy them again.  I'm not sure I'd share them just yet, maybe just direct them to Amazon so they can get their own pack.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2016
comment: These taste great!  I grew up eating arare (rice crackers) so I consider myself somewhat of a rice cracker snob.  I would always want the pieces that were the darkest, they were either toasted the most or had the most soy sauce on them, either way they had the best flavor.  If you are the kind of person that likes the browned bits of rice that sits in the bottom of your rice cooker then you know what I mean.  These crackers are nice and dark, full of flavor and very crispy.  So many of the rice crackers you see in stores today are pale and don't look too appetizing.  I was somewhat cautious about ordering these rice crackers since they were made in Taiwan and in my opinion the best ones come from Japan.  However these are absolutely delicious. I read that some people have had issues with broken pieces (NOT ME) or the price (about $12.00 per pound).  An 8 ounce package of rice crackers locally sells for $5.00-5.50, That's $10-11 per pound for much inferior rice crackers.  These are not cheap but well worth the price.  I won't be buying them every week, but maybe once a month????

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2017
comment_title: My go to brand for mochi crunch
comment: This is one of the best mochi crunch brand there is.  I've tried many different brands and as far as the taste goes.  This is one of the best.  For one, it doesn't taste too salty like some other arare.  I also like the convenience of having to purchase this myself with free prime shipping (with membership).  The fact that I don't have to bother my friends or relatives there.  Just get this myself.  It's an expensive product, but, 2 lbs, 6 oz, that's alot of mochi crunch in one bottle.  I don't know of any other company that does that.  I think is because they have such a great product that people are willing to pay for a full bottle of arare.  Besides the point, I could continue to make my furikake mochi crunch butter popcorn (similar to hurricane popcorn).  Just as tasty but, better flavor.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019
comment: I was very satisfied with the taste and freshness of the crackers. As I poured them out of the bag, I realized the same thing that many other reviewers stated...there was a lot of small, crushed pieces. I ordered the large golden-colored bag and it was shipped in a soft package. Maybe that is what caused so much damage. I did not serve these at my party as anticipated and will be contacting o company. Crackers cost too much to be shipped in such poor condition.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020
comment: First off, let me say I have in the past always ordered the Aloha brand mix and been extremely satisfied. However when I saw this product with a greater quantity for approximately the same price, I decided to chance it. Bad mistake.When I first opened the package and tasted the mix it was similar to the Aloha brand, but not quite as intense. Still it had an acceptable and pleasing flavor. However when I poured out some mix in a bowl, I was shocked to see that at least the third if not more of all of the small pieces we're broken. See my photo. In fact when I looked closely I saw that there were pieces that were plain and others that had seaweed in them. It was obvious to me that these are what was swept up from several different production lines, not the high-quality product that I expected.Although I did eventually consume the whole bag, it was irritating because the number of broken pieces got larger and larger till the very bottom where everything was small and crushed.Save your money and aggravation. Buy the Aloha brand instead.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020
comment: This updates a previous review.  The taste and crispness of Tomoe is our favorite.  However, I've asked the shipper to bubble wrap and box it for shipping to prevent receiving lots of crumbs.  Request ignored.  They continue to ship it in an envelope.  We continue to get a bag with a considerable amount of crumbs.  We also found out that although Tomoe is known not to use MSG in their arare, this package version does contain MSG.  They advertise in their description on Amazon no MSG.  Read the ingedients on the package.  MSG is one of the ingredients.  We will not be ordering this again :-(

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2019
comment: I grew up on Umeya rice crackers- when I was a kid we'd always get the jumbo bags of them from the Umeya store in downtown Los Angeles. Since Umeya is no more, I started looking for a good alternative. The best tasting and best deal I've found is the Tomoe Brand Hawaiian Mix Arare in the jumbo bag. These have really good flavor and the 38 oz bag lasts for a while. One big plus is they don't use those chemical food coloring dyes to make their Arare like a lot of the other companies do. My only regret is not finding these sooner. Anyway buy a bag- you won't regret it!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2019
comment: If you like rice crackers, real rice crackers with good flavor these are for you.  If they are so good why did I only give them 3 stars?  90% of the crackers were broken and I threw away a large part of the bag since they were “dust”.  I would buy more but it makes no sense to buy something where you throw away so much of the product.  I do not blame the shipping either.  I believe these were broken well before they were shipped to me.  They did have a very nice flavor though.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2020
comment_title: Good... but no difference in taste among the shapes.
comment: Usually, when I buy rice crackers, there is a distinct difference in taste in the assortment.  Some are sweet, some are salty, some spicy, some taste of the nori shreds on them.  These all taste the same, with the same coating;  the only thing different is in the shape.  Not exactly what I was expecting.However, they do taste good:  nicely salty, fresh, and crunchy.  I'm knocking off one star because it appeared that this would be a true assortment and it's not.  But... I've ordered several other types of rice crackers to mix into it (especially chili bits!), and then I'll have the snack assortment of my dreams  :-DBy the way, these crackers do go extremely well with peanut-butter-stuffed pretzel bites if you like the latter.

comment: So yummy!  This is the flavor I’ve been looking for.  So often rice cracker mixes have those white ones that are too bland. comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2019
comment_title: Tasty, crunchy, fresh, low-fat, and cheap
comment: Delicious classic arare. Different shapes, but they all taste about the same. Very fresh and crunchy, and a decent value at about 58 cents per oz ($22). I love how low-fat they are, 0 grams, with relatively few ingredients: rice, soy sauce, sesame, seaweed, MSG. Not gluten free, the soy sauce has wheat.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019
comment: These Golden Duck Gourmet Salted Egg Yolk Fish Skin Crisps Chips were undeniably delicious. Crispy, a little spicy, and they just melt in your mouth. My wife, who is incredibly picky when it comes to chips, found these to be fragrant and crispy ( as the name suggests) and actually requested that we ordered more in the future, to my surprise!I do want to note that given that these are pretty oily, so eating too much will definitely lead to a bit of throat uncomfortableness. It's really a matter of self-control when making sure that you don't eat all the crisps in one sitting. With some tea or some water, I think that these chips are much easier to digest, and you'll definitely thank me later for the tip. If only they sold these chips in my hometown, I'd be purchasing them monthly for the whole family to enjoy! For the price that you pay, it is also a little expensive; most chip bags do have quite a bit of air though. It is undeniable, however, that the bags are fresh, and the fish used is fresh and results in chips that are fare from stale.

It  felt like a bird farted in my mouth and then a goldfish came and died in it.  I drank water to get rid of the taste and my cup started smelling like a dirty pond. comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2017
comment_title: ... to have a real taste for the sea to love this.
comment: You have to have a real taste for the sea to love this...Seaweed is good for the iodine it provides, helps move your bowls and over all, is good for your health.  I eat it directly from the pack, but it's excellent with smoked salmon and light cream cheese spread on it or in Asian style soups....Yum!  The one bad thing is it will turn your breath fouler than anything...it's indescribable, so be sure to brush your teeth, gums and tongue (especially the back of your tongue)...and then repeat it again...SERIOUSLY, you do not want to talk closely with anyone after eating this or you will forever leave a bad impression!

Honestly, i can't tell them apart (though admittedly it's best a few months or more since i had that competing brand).When i finish the last of these i'll move on to another brand and review those, too.  ^_^

comment_title: I love it and so does the fish.
comment: "Blub blub blub blub. Blub blub - blub. Blub." - Pinot the Goldfish

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2012
comment: If you love sushi, you'll also love these seaweed snacks.  They are my new favorite low-carb snack, and perfect for when I feel like munching on something (like when I'm watching a movie).  I have type 1 diabetes, and have to watch my carb intake.  I consider these snacks to be a "free food" as they do not impact my blood sugar, and I do not need to take any insulin when I eat it. The ones I ordered did not have a wasabi taste to them, but a nice, pleasant, lightly roasted sesame taste.  They melt in your mouth and are a healthier alternative to chips, nuts, or popcorn when you need a little snack.I don't have a Trader Joe's where I live, so I'm glad I can order these from Amazon.  I will definitely be ordering more! :-)

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2013
comment: Trader Joe's Roasted Seaweed Snacks are delicious.  I crave them the way most people crave potato chips.  They're low in calories (60 calories for the entire package) and contain beneficial minerals that you might not get elsewhere, so you can eat a ton of them without feeling guilty.  It's an excellent product.The problem was that these were shipped in a bag, not a box.  This would be fine if the plastic box inside the wrapping were rigid, but it's not.  Every box was flattened at some point during shipping.  Seaweed snacks don't really bend without breaking.  Everything was broken into little shards that drifted around the inside of the package during shipping, so when I went to open one of the packages, the seaweed on the outside of its container got all over the place.  Since these are made with oil, it's very hard to get little bits off of a surface.  Eating them without making a mess was equally difficult.  You'd think for $5 shipping the sellers would at least make sure the product made it to the buyer in one piece.  I wish they had taken the care to use a box rather than a bag.  What I really wish was that I'd just made the trip to Trader Joe's and bought them there.  I'm very disappointed.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2011
comment: This salty, savory gem is so satisfying.  Packaged in an airtight container, it is as fresh and crisp as the moment it was packed at the factory.  Each package has only 60 calories--and that's for two servings!  The seaweed comes in thin, rectangular sheets of a beautiful shade of green.  As you take a bite, the crisp sheet reminds you of biting into a potato chip or popcorn--crunch and a bit of salt.  Once on your tongue, it begins to dissolve, giving you a more gelatinous texture.  If you enjoy Japanese foods such as sushi, this is for you.What a great, low calorie alternative to take to the movies.  Or, to lunch, to eat at your desk, in the car, at sports events, on the plane.  Easy to handle, small, crunchy, salty, chewy.  M-m-m, just plain yummy.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2018
comment: I love roasted seaweed snacks. I have purchased these directly from a Trader Joe's store. This brand is on the bland and flimsy side of the seaweed snack spectrum, but they are tasty enough. The upside of seaweed snacks for me is the iodine content. If you've never tried seaweed snacks before, they may be an acquired taste. The downside is that they are made with canola oil which is unhealthy because it inhibits enzyme function among other effects. There are other brands which are canola-free. Had these been canola-free, I could only wish that the people who dumped theirs in the trash would have sent them my way. Based on that fact that there are seaweed snacks with healthier ingredients, I won't be buying these again. In fact, I will try making them at home with a recipe found in my search for canola-free snacks. If you do eat these, you may experience digestive upsets if you consume more than a few at a time. I don't know if it's because of the canola oil or if it's seaweed-related, but this seems to be a common side effect.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2015
comment_title: Great for hypothyroid .. DOES NOT contribute to acne & Good price & Taste great
comment: At first I gave this a low-rating, since I thought it contributed to my kid's acne.  After 1 year of using this, I upgrade to 5-stars.  It has zero effect on my teenager's acne, but helps her hypothyroid, since Kelp has iodine, necessary for thyroid function.  This product also has 8% vitamin A (helps with skin & thyroid), plus 20% vitamin C, and 2% iron.  One pack has only 30 calories, and only 99 cents at Trader's Joe.I notice that I nap easier when I snack on this for breakfast.  I appreciate this product for is low-cost, low-calories, and how it helps my teenager daughter with her hypothyroid .. her skin is clear, despite having one pack per day.  Seaweed has minerals:  iodine, potassium, magnesium, calcium and iron.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2013

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2016
comment_title: Too much packaging but tastes great
comment: These taste great and are nutritious -- my 9 year old son who won't eat anything but meat and junk food (chips, french fries, etc) loves them. Here is my complaint: the packaging creates a LOT of waste. I try to get him to cut up the plastic--its bulky and takes up a lot of space in the trash can/recycle bin. And the outer wrapping does not ball up well either. I am looking for a company that packages theirs differently but is as economical and tasty as this. Anyone know of one?

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2014
comment: These seaweed snacks are definitely not for everyone, but worth trying.  If you like sushi then you will recognize the flavor of the wrapper.  My daughter and I picked some up just to try, then we were both trying not to eat them all.  They are so good!  They are crunchy, crispy and very flavorful.  They aren't too salty either.  I don't like salty foods.  The sesame oil added the perfect touch of flavor to put them over the top.  My husband also thought that they were okay, but he wasn't crazy about the thin paper-like consistency.  That texture is what I thinks makes them great for a healthy snack.  You don't need to eat a lot to get the flavors.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2012
comment: I'm no vegetarian, and am certainly not a "granola girl," yet I find these so amazingly tasty! There's just a moderately salty crunch at first, and then they basically "melt in your mouth." The flavor is exactly like the seaweed wrapped around sushi rolls; no "fishy" taste.Like other reviewers, I initially decided to try these because (1) they're crazy-low in calories, and (2) I'd heard about how healthy seaweed is. So glad I did! These - remarkably - satisfy my husband's salty-crunchy cravings, so we don't buy any potato chips/tortilla chips/pretzels/popcorn anymore!I really wanted to dock a star for (1) wanting to eat more than are in each package (aka: the package is too small), and (2) because they're pretty pricey compared to other salty-crunchy snacks. But, I just couldn't do it. They are too darn delicious! I would buy these in bulk at Sam's Club if I could!Side note: I haven't done any research on the health benefits of dried v. fresh seaweed. I suspect that fresh has many more vitamins/nutrients, but that's purely my own speculation. If anyone has any info on this...please comment on my review so I can take a look. Thanks!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2016
comment: I get these from trader joes. I had them a few years ago and HATED them!!! Thought they were nasty! Fast forward to now. I am eating a low carb diet and wanted a snack so I bought some knowing my husband likes them so if I hated them again it wouldn't go to waste. I tried one... ugh... yuck. Tried it once more and then I was hooked. Now I am lucky if I don't eat a whole package.  It is an acquired taste. So you really can't judge by the reviews. I once hated them now I love them.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2012
comment_title: If heaven came in a bag ...
comment: It would be called Trader Joe's Roasted Seaweed Snack.These dried pieces of seaweed are lightly coated in sesame oil and salt for a crisp, delicious snack. I'd never tried roasted seaweed before but I decided to give them a try. Needless to say, I now consider myself a seaweed addict.Seaweed has many healthy things in it that we most likely don't get from other sources of food we eat. The best thing about this snack is that you can eat the whole bag (and trust me, you will) and it's only 60 calories.You will pay a lot lower price if you buy it in the store rather than from Amazon. Not everyone has a local store to them so at least you have somewhere to buy this yummy treat!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2012
comment: This review is going to sound very different from a normal one.First off, I would like to point out that yes, I gave it four stars on purpose.  Please keep that in mind and read this very thoroughly.I hate these snacks.  I hate them because they are so insanely addictive, I find it nearly impossible to "just have one."  Invariably, I end up consuming the entire package grinning like a giddy schoolchild.  Even if I put them away, I will inevitably find myself searching the package out, just so I can have one more.. and then again, and again, until the package is finally empty, and then I am sad.I hate them because of their fun, paper-thin texture, which makes it seem like you've some piece of unique candy, then it turns out to be a delicious, slightly salty, somewhat chewy snack which makes your brain scream 'Oooh, yay, SUSHI!' only for it to suddenly turn nutty in a twist which makes me want to have just one more to experience that fun crinkle of the sheets (for they are super-thin sheets of dried, roasted seaweed), the YAY of incoming sushi, that slightly chewy transformation, and then they dissolve into almost nothingness, leaving you reaching for another one.I hate them because the pack lasts about 45 minutes.  An hour and a half, if I'm demonstrating exceptionally strong willpower for the day.  Possibly longer if I can manage to convince someone *else* to hide them from me.I hate them because said pack gives me 40% of my Vitamin C for the day in less than half an ounce of actual dried seaweed.  And something that tastes so very delicious isn't supposed to be that healthy.  Bacon doesn't give vitamin C.  These snacks do.  That's confusing.  Snacks are supposed to be guilty pleasures, not delightful dietary supplements.I hate them because the only physical store that carries them in my area is Trader Joe's, and I always end up opening the pack after they are closed.  So when the package is empty and I am sad, I must wait until morning to "get my fix" again.I hate them because I ate an entire package while writing this review.  And now it is gone.  And now I am sad.  Thankfully, though, I can get them here and have them delivered to my door.  I might have to order a few of the six packs, though, to last me until the next order I place can arrive.  I'm working out a rationing calendar that I probably won't stick to for more than an hour.And finally, I hate that I don't hate these at all, but am hopelessly and utterly addicted to them.  Seaweed Anonymous, thou art my name.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2012
comment: I received a package of Trader Joe's Roasted Seaweed Snack for my 23rd birthday. Growing up deeply entrenched in Asian cuisine, I knew before trying it that it was more than likely not going to be to my tastes. If you like products such as grass jelly or sushi, or anything that is pungent and tastes like plant material without being om nom nom delicious, this is for you.This product is not recommended for small children. There's not enough sugar in it.This product is also not recommended for vegans and seliacs. While it is gluten free and animal-product free, you can do something better for yourselves by finding an alternative snack without the bay water flavor.This product is not recommended for people with heart disease or who are at risk for developing heart disease. It's a high sodium choice.This product is not recommended for alcoholics. You'll start drinking again.This product is not recommended for cigarette smokers. Save your money for your cancer sticks.This product IS recommended for users of Mountain Dew, grass or ai ju jelly, pickled radish, bean thread, sushi, menudo, mole sauce, adobo sauce, specialty bell peppers, bouncy balls, pencil and pen erasers, rubber soles, rubber in general, motor oil, gasoline/petrol, radioactive isotopes, unidentified rare earth metals, tapeworms, Buffalo Bills fans, fruit cake, Hostess snacks, corn, rat, and/or chicken snakes, parents of teenagers (for use as a punishment agent on those late night sneak outs), water bottles, organic milk, Tuscan Whole Milk, Three Wolf Moon shirts, wolf shirts in general, Twilight readers, and insomniacs.The flavor matches wonderfully with a fresh whole rabbit, such as the one listed on this site.I would rate it higher than two stars in the regards that it's a wonderful seaweed product. However, I don't like it. That's the definition of two stars.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2013

comment_title: Expensive, sort of chalky, slightly sweet.
comment: Though this is probably slightly healthier than regular chips, the flavor and texture are odd.  I like salted duck eggs and I like salmon skin, but this was a little bit sweet and smelled a bit fishy.Sweet + seafood + chalky texture from yolk = kinda weird/gross?Perhaps if this had been less chalky and just savory and spicy, it would've been better. comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2018
comment: It's so farrrr, but it taste so good. It's a shame you can only get the original from singapore and the company doesn't ship it internationally so you have to find 3rd party sellers. That said this brand of fish chips are really good. The chips r not overly salty, just the right amount of savory and not particularly strong smelling. There are also small crispy green stuff inside, not sure if it is basil or parsley or some other fragrant edible green.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2019
comment: So much flavor, lots of different notes of spices (chili, curry leaf), not just salted egg yolk. No fishiness like the other salt fish skin snack (of course that was much cheaper). After hearing that this is much better from different friends and watching an video about IRVINS founder, I was willing to shell out to try it and it delivered.Shipped from overseas and I expected it a month or two after I ordered, but pleasantly surprised I got it in East coast US in 2 weeks.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2019
comment: These do seem expensive, but it's a lot cheaper than trying to get a plane to Singapore to buy it yourself! These are as dangerously addictive as they claim to be, so I'd recommend you keep them someplace separate from your home so you don't end up eating the whole bag at once. Another thing you might do is immediately open the bag and separate the contents into smaller bags or containers so you somehow limit yourself (or slow yourself down).

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2019

I can see why these are a favorite in Asia.  They are much healthier than potato chips and other junk snacks but are really healthy.  I will buy more.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2020
comment: Firstly, they have an odd taste.  I'm not sure how to describe it other than kind of earthy and vegetable at the same time.  I found that off putting.The crackers themselves are good.  They need more flavor, though.  My eyes barely watered and my nose was relatively dry when eating these.  I'm looking for a sinus flush reaction!  When I found clusters of crackers I got the one-two punch effect, but it dissipated quickly.  My husband could tell when I was eating these because they had an odor.  Our office is 37 feet long and I am behind a hutch.  He could smell them as he was coming up the stairs, which are across the room from my desk.  He would say, "damnit, baby, are you eating Those Things again?!"  I would proudly smile and stuff another handful in my mouth as I nodded emphatically.  :DThe best thing about these - no Peas!  I never had to worry about cracking a tooth on a cracker that was denser than it was supposed to be and that's a big bonus.  Sometimes those peas are like stones!Unfortunately that flavor I can't quite describe was too detrimental and I can't bring myself to order more.  The search continues for a snack that will make me cry and clear my sinuses.

comment_title: Fresh and enough wasabi to burn your nostrils!!

I decided to try these after reading other reviews about the strong wasabi presence, and they were correct. I ate a small handful at once and it actually made me sneeze, which IMO is fantastic. I find a lot of wasabi flavored snacks are weak, these are good and strong. Highly recommended, some of the best spicy arare crackers I've had.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2019
comment_title: All kinds of wrong, and absolutely addictive
comment: Man, there is so much that is wrong with pork scratchings, and I love them for every single thing.First, this product is not at all the same as pork rinds as you know them in the States. If you buy pork scratchings thinking they are the same, you will be revolted. If - like me, when I first came here - you buy pork rinds thinking they are the same as pork scratchings, you will be depressed at the state of modern humanity.Both products are made from pigs, and both taste of pork. There the resemblance ends.Now, my memory is that these used to be called pork crackling back in the day, a traditional British snack that you bought in the pub with a beer, or loosely packed in plastic bags from old-school butchers. But everyone called them pork scratchings, and the manufacturers fell into line some time ago.You do not want to think about why we called them pork scratchings, or about what they are, or what they look like. All you need to know is that they are delicious.What you get is a whole bunch of teeny, tiny packets of triple-fried pork skins. Little lumps of massive salted pork flavor from the skin and occasional flecks of meat, and supercharged umami from the generous coating of fat on each piece. In the butchers' version you could also sometimes find bonus treats like triple-fried hair or pig's nipple, but I've not found those here (shame!). It's the flavor, the umami, and the salt that you're buying here, and as I see it, in each teeny tiny packet you get twice as much flavor as in a big bag of US-style pork rinds. It's a bargain.To put it another way; you know those roasted seaweed snacks you can get from Korea? Healthy, delicate and nicely balanced whispers that melt in your mouth? British pork scratchings are the precise opposite of that.Have I mentioned the crunch? It's a great crunch. So good in fact, and so strong, that you won't even notice if you break a tooth when biting down. (Which was a distinct risk when eating pork scratchings back in the day. They seem to have pulled back a bit on the modern crunch. I blame dentists for that.)I love them and you will too (I'm assuming you're not a vegetarian if you're reading this review).You have been warned.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2018
comment_title: You've found them. Your quest is finally over.
comment: I know why you're here. You're looking for cracklings. Not pork rinds; cracklings. Pork rinds don't compare once you've gotten the itch. You've tasted the exquisite masterpiece that is the belly and still yearn; each piece deep fried until the fat has turned into a crisp honeycomb of bacon-like ecstacy, ensconced within the crunch of flavor-packed skin. Go no further, the great swine god has passed his favor upon you today. You've found sheer pork nirvana.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2018
comment: OH MY GOODNESS!!! I received them today (surprisingly fast, less than 4 days in transit, so thank you Royal Mail and US Mail for satisfying my cravings!!! ) Thank you Mr. Porky, for your wonderful treats, your recipe is perfect!! I love the taste, the crunchiness, the serving size!!! I already had 2 bags (I am ketogenic and these come in perfectly  handy with the amount of fat I need and basically 0 carbs and sugar), my hubby had 1 but I have to hide the rest cause he is ready to devour more, I can feel it.I am Romanian living in California, U.S. and I have to agree with the other buyers and reviewers: the European recipe for pork scratchings is not the same with the American pork rinds. I personally LOVE the Brits, including the pork scratchings! Yummoo!!!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2015
comment_title: Savory, Flavorful and Brings Back So Many Great Memories! Viva the UK!
comment: My family was stationed in England via the USAF in the 1980's. We lived off base (what they called, "on the economy") and a block from a nice village pub. My dad would go every other Saturday night while me, my siblings, and my mom would have family movie night at home. My dad would ask all of us kids which pub snacks he wanted us to bring home. My choice was always pork scratchings. Sunday morning we would awake to see our treats laid out for us on the dining room table.Now, I live back in the USA and have tried so many different pork rinds, scratchings, etc but have yet to come across an authentically British version of these. The Mexican ones are close but still not the same. I'm so happy to have finally found some here on Amazon.Mr. Porky Pork Scratchings are the real deal!! Crunchy on the outside, chewy/soft inside and filled with lots of flavor. They are a tad on the salty side but they make for an excellent every-now-and-then snack.I told my dad about them and he's happily looking forward to me shipping some to him soon.I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a quality pork scratching. Whether you have memories from the UK or have never tried them and would like to give it a go, this is the brand I would recommend.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2015
comment_title: Buy this artery destroying deliciousness now
comment: Yes yes yes yes yes yes, get in my belly you delicious pieces of piggy joy.As a Brit in the USA, I can't find good quality pork scratchings, a product I rarely if ever ate while in the UK, but now that I'm 4k miles from them I bizarrely crave.The American Hublet loved them and understands why the bubbly, fluffy, light American pork bits of fluff don't satisfy in the same way.Plus, it's a pub card filled with perfectly sized bags of porky deliciousness, you can't go wrong.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2014
comment: These cost 97 cents each at Trader Joe's. Why would anyone pay more than twice as much as 6 of them would cost in the store? Convenience isn't worth that :/  I really wish I lived closer to Trader Joe's, but I still won't pay this much for wasabi seaweed. Why not just make it a 12 pack for the same price? It's not like the weight would cost shipping prices to go up. You could balance a box of 12 packs on your fingertips no problem lol. Quite a shame :/

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2019
comment_title: Price is a bit too steep for me
comment: These are a great snack. Packed with flavor. Some can have more kick of spice then you expect but overall are pretty darn good. However, they literally cost .99 cents at Trader Joe's. You're paying $15 for a six pack plus shipping and handling. For that amount you can buy an entire box (I believe it's 12 inside a box) at the store and still have money left over. Not worth buying online buy definitely worth buying.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2017
comment_title: Love them but they have sugar.
comment: We love them, they are great with rice and avocado or with stir fry veg. My kids like the original better.If you don't finish the pack it gets too damp and it's not crispy anymore.  And so you have to eat it all, even when I put it in a seal bag still not the same.And they have sugar. So I guess I keep to kelp

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2012
comment_title: If heaven came in a bag...
comment: It would be called Trader Joe's Roasted Seaweed Snack.These dried pieces of seaweed are lightly coated in sesame oil and salt for a crisp, delicious snack. I'd never tried roasted seaweed before but I decided to give them a try. Needless to say, I now consider myself a seaweed addict.Seaweed has many healthy things in it that we most likely don't get from other sources of food we eat. The best thing about this snack is that you can eat the whole bag (and trust me, you will) and it's only 60 calories.You will pay a lot lower price if you buy it in the store rather than from Amazon. Not everyone has a local store to them so at least you have somewhere to buy this yummy treat!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2012
comment: I only tried these a few weeks ago (they're 99 cents at Trader Joe's for a packet of about 20 pieces) and I think they're the perfect snack. At only 60 calories for the whole thing, you can't beat it for a quick salty treat. I fold one piece into 4 sections and pop it in. Since it has a wasabi seasoning on it, at first taste you think "Oh my God, what have I done", but the heat only lasts for about 3 seconds and then the flavor sets in. You really do have to get these by the 10 pack cause you can easily scarf down 2 boxes without even thinking about it.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2012
comment: I've been addicted to these lately, even got some odd stares one day when I cleared the whole shelf of these little bags into my cart at Trader Joes. Its the prefect thing to fight a mid afternoon craving while still having tons of flavor. I tried Annie Chungs once and was amazed how bland they were compared to these.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2013
comment: This is like methadone for sushi addicts - but it is also very addicting!  I buy it by a case of 40 from Trader Joe's every couple of weeks. I've tried two other brands of wasabi seaweed snacks and Trader Joe's is by far superior (and cheaper...at the store).

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2013
comment: I like this, but it is a pretty hefty kick from the wasabi. Maybe because I eat it driving home from Trader Joe's and don't rest my mouth between. I like the other, non-wasabi, variety a bit better.If you don't like nori, or don't eat sushi, then you might not care for this. Nori tastes like the ocean. Salty, a bit of fish flavor... I love it. The roasted nori is awesome. It's like almost calorie free potato chips.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2012
comment: Here's a snack you gotta try. It's toasted seaweed with a slight wasabi flavor and lightly salted. It smells and tastes a little "fishy," but it's quite good. Plus it has almost no calories so it's guilt free. Interesting product!Gary Peterson

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2014
comment: My coworker brought these in to the office recently, and after sampling it, I fell in love. I went to the local West Hartford, CT location and bought 5 of the Wasabi flavor. I am going back today to buy whatever is left on the shelf! If you love sushi, you will love these. The Wasabi flavor isn't overbearing for my taste as I adore Asian cuisine of all kinds. I have kicked a LOT of bad habits including being a problem gambler (2 years next week ;) , but I don't know if I can stop eating these!!!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2012
comment: I was hesitant to try but I figured what the heck worth a try and I was very glad I did. They are crispy with lots of salty wasabi flavor. Does not have a fishy flavor which is what I was afraid would happen. A whole package has only 60 total calories (2 servings.) Really a yummy treat. My newest favorite snack.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2015
comment: I LOVE their seaweed, but I've been trying to decipher lately where my hidden sugar consumption has been coming from. Here is one blindsiding culprit. The wasabi one specifically has sugar listed on the ingredient list. I was SO DISAPPOINTED. Now I buy the regular in lieu of a sugar-laced product. READ the labels on your food as sugar hides under several aliases (including terms like corn syrup solids and brown rice syrup).

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2012
comment: If you like roasted seaweed and wasabi you will love these. One negative reviewer probably does not like wasabi and seaweed. I have had several brands of wasabi seaweed and this is bar far the best! I buy 10 at a time now from Trader Joes. If you can get online, go for it!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2012
comment_title: Like licking a dirty fish tank
comment: My wife bought these for me because she knows I love wasabi and will eat just about anything coated with it.  There was almost no wasabi taste to the two chips I tried (I threw the rest out).  The only taste I got was a strong nasty "fishy" taste.  Now I'm not one of those nuts who orders fish in a restaurant and then complains about it tasting like fish (gasp).  These tasted like fish that is spoiled, hence my title.  Two cans of diet pepsi and I can't get the awful taste off of my poor tongue.  On the plus side, the guys at work got a good laugh out of my misfortune.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2013
comment: Seaweed snacks are a great alternative to chips and other less healthy snacks, and I concur with the positive taste ratings others have given here. comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2013
comment: These seaweed snacks are a fantastic snack and the chipotle flavor provides just enough heat & flavor to make it interesting, without being overwhelming. I love the fact that I've replaced chips with seaweed snacks, as they are much healthier, and yet I hardly notice the difference because the flavor of these is so great. My only complaint is that these are pretty expensive and so I don't buy them regularly. Instead, I will typically buy the Kirkland brand seaweed because they give you a lot more for your money. The downside there is that they don't have Chipotle flavors like this, but I'm willing to dip them in my own hot sauce to accomplish that aim.Highly recommend any type of seaweed snack as a healthier alternative to chips & other traditional junk food...

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2013
comment: I originally ordered a sample pack of all four flavors through Groupon and loved these so much I came back for more. I've had some seaweed snacks that tasted very fishy but this one is not overpowering in that way. The chipotle does have a pretty good kick to it, so if you don't like spicy this might not be the one for you. I also really like the onion flavor. The wasabe is quite overpowering, so unless you really enjoy that flavor I wouldn't recommend that one.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2018
comment_title: Great introduction into what the kids eat on the other side of the world.
comment: We bought ours from the seller AKIBA King and we were very pleased with the product. It arrived almost exactly (2 days less) than a month after purchase. The contents were varied and closely resembled what I had expected (from product pictures). There was an expiration date guide included. One item (one of the sticks in the top right of my photo) expired 2 days after arrival, so we ate that first (it was tasty). A few expire towards the end of this month, and the rest seem to expire around about 3 months from arrival with an outlier here or there. I haven't eaten all of them yet, but I will say from looking and being the type of person who has ordered quite a few of these Japanese candy/snack boxes that this isn't for the type of person who only wants to eat stereotypical American type of candy. This is for someone who wants to legitimately try snacks that another country would eat, including the wasabi seaweed type of flavors (one that was included in my pack).

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2016
comment_title: If you have a Japanese snack lover, BUY THIS!
comment: For the price, this box of snacks was a total deal! It had TONS of unique stuff I've never tried before and got to share with my wife, and I STILL have snacks left over after receiving the box a month or two ago! It came quickly, and it was well packaged and clearly cared for by whoever was transporting it. None of the snacks inside were busted or old, and all looked freshly bought. Overall, it was totally worth it and I will be buying again in the future!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2017
comment: I was anticipating this package for the longest time, and when it came a week earlier than expected I was absolutely ecstatic! I'm Japanese and miss Japanese snacks but I live in a place where no one sells it nearby, so I'm glad such a thing like this exists. It's neatly packaged in a box and nothing appears to be cracked or smashed, and I'm actually quite happy with the fact some flavors are randomized! I will warn however that most of this isn't the popular Japanese food like Pocky, so if you're not used to the taste of Japanese snacks I recommend a package that has more conventional brands before moving onto packages like these. Finally, there's no English description in the box (at least for mine) for the flavors and ingredients, so keep that in mind if that would be an issue!

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2015
comment_title: great seller! So I like most of the colors
comment: I ordered my pack from Kolorize Me whom I also reviewed, great seller! So I like most of the colors. The metallics are gorgeous but not what I was expecting. They're not quite what I personally would call metallic. More like a very heavy pearl. Still gorgeous! But I'll have to look elsewhere for the perfect metallic polish. The neons are gorgeous and CRAZY BRIGHT! Not quite neon but the next tier of obnoxiously bright. The pastels are perfect! They remind me of Easter lol. The only one I didn't like that much was the purple. Well, I like it but I think it's too dark for pastel (very pale skin here). I also got the holo polishes that KC makes. I really love Chunky Holo Black the best (I think everyone does). The formula for these polishes doesn't really seem to be incredibly consistent. I played around with about 30 different colors already and can see that some of the polishes apply REALLY well and others don't. Meaning, some I could apply one coat and get away with. Others, I gave up at 3. The obvious ones are the holos, I know that already. But others like Neon Lime, Funky Yellow and Sheer Lilac were still pretty see through. For the purposes I need them for (Stamping and nail art), I'll have to mess around with each color individually to get a feel for it or else I wind up with splotchy nails that look like a mess. For the price you pay on this particular pack, it's a killer deal. I'd definitely recommend it for someone who is looking into playing around with a lot of color or is maybe a novice. The price = many chances to mess up and not worry. But if you're used to QUALITY nail polish, I'd steer clear of this. I attached a photo , please ignore the 6 in the middle and the lip gloss. Those aren't part of this review. :)

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2015
comment_title: I really think this was a nice purchase. I was telling a co-worker about this
comment: I really think this was a nice purchase. I was telling a co-worker about this, and she decided to go half with me. We each paid $20 then whenever the order came she picked one, i picked one until we went through the bottles. Many of the colors in this collection are very pretty!!! It also comes with qa few matte polishes.. I thought this was going to be a clear matte top coat to many any polish have a matte finish. Actually the colors themself turn matte. I believe there is a black one and then a shimmery magenta one.. it turns out nice because its shimmery, yet flat bc of the matte. The colors go on nice and dont take too long to dry. Dont get me wrong, these are not Essie polishes, but they do the job if you want to add to your collection without spending $10/bottle.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2014
comment: This is an awesome set. My order had some missing polishes and some bottles that couldn't even be opened or were damaged but seller took care of quickly and easily.  Most colors give great coverage and have great pigment but I find some of the colors so sheer that approx 4+ coats are needed (garnet red, sheer pastels). If you do stamping, some of these polishes will not work for you. Polishes don't have to horrible of a smell. Kleancolor polishes have great no chipping life spans for me (I'm pretty rough on my hands).  Would recommend and purchase again.

comment: I just received my package last night. I am beyond thrilled with it. Kleancolor is a brand that I use almost exclusively. The large box was the perfect size for the small boxes so there was no rattling around.I painted my nails last night the beautiful metalic red color. I love it. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who is looking to be able to paint their nails in a variety of colors, frequently. I can't speak to the longevity of the polish as I change almost daily. But I definitely love the Kleancolor brand.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2019
comment: I LOVE Marys crackers!! All flavors! They are an amazing snack and very very tasty! So; why? a 1 star harsh review???Easy. EVERY time I order (generally 3-4 boxes at a time) there a box or 2 that are literally crumbs! LITERALLY! Just broken assed crumbs. I actually think Amazon has a cracker (and cereal too) shake and break machine. its absolutely ridiculous! So much that I simply cannot buy them anymore (or bread, or cereal, or any type of chip or cracker, they don't discriminate) from Amazon and just need to pay more and buy them retail to get a decent box of unbroken crackers.Lame.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2018
comment: this product is not what i expected. i eat mary's super seed everything crackers on a regular basis and immediately noticed an unfortunate difference with these crackers (advertised as mary's super seed everything in the customary box).  fewer seeds, more crispy (possible burnt), and mostly broken pieces. ordinarily, the plastic bag containing the crackers is stamped with the flavor, best-by date and lot #. the bag in this box does not have that stamp. i'm suspicious that this is not an authentic product. 1 star because order came ahead of schedule. will definitely not order again.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2018
comment: These crackers are healthier than any other crackers I have found.  They are perfect for vegans. I don't worry about veering  off the vegan way of life with these crackers.  Glad I was led to them by my daughter.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2020
comment: I have received 3 boxes, one monthly, with Subscribe & Save.  I would have given 5 stars, and this may be due to Amazon's packing, but about half of the crackers are broken into pieces that are so small you can only eat them with your fingers.  You cannot scoop dip or spread hummus on them because they are so small.  A good part of the pieces are so small they are actually crumbs.  It is really a shame because the crackers that survived the shipping are thin, very crispy and tasty.  I used to buy Mary's crackers from Costco, and the product was never as pulverized as the 3 boxes I have received.  The S&S price is really good, but not for crumbs.  I will be canceling further orders.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2017
comment_title: Some crackers broken but flavor is good
comment: I had never seen these crackers before in the store, but they seemed like a slightly healthier alternative to saltines.  My kiddo loves crackers right now, and I thought I'd give these a go.  The box arrived in tact, but there were quite a few crackers inside that were broken in half -- still very edible but not as convenient a size.  The flavor is good, and I will see if I can find them in my local stores for more regular purchasing.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2020
comment: I got these because I had previously purchased the Mary's Gone Super Seed Classic crackers - and they were AMAZING. These EVERYTHING ones are DISGUSTING. They taste bitter and burnt. I took a picture of the CLASSIC next to the EVERYTHING and the everything cracker is much smaller in size, which leads me to believe they're burnt. Anyway... I'll be avoiding these and getting the Classic instead (but how disappointing that there is no quality control!).

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020
comment: I tried these on a whim b/c I went gluten-free. Choices in our market are limited. I saw these and immediately ordered the Black Pepper cracker. O.M.G. They are delicious! Snappy, super-crisp, just unique! The carb load isn't bad if you munch 'em in moderation. They are great with low-fat cream cheese, topped with various veggie slices, including carrot, cucumber, radish, and on and on. A tad of hot pepper jelly is wicked good! Highly recommend! Just wish they were less expensive.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019
comment_title: Healthy nutty taste with a crunch
comment: I've tried out 30 different cracker brands when we set out to find non white flour crackers. Mary's crackers have consistently stayed #1 in our family. You have to chew a little longer than most because - well, its all seeds! But they make this cracker very nutty and flavorful and plenty of that crunch when you crave crunchy.I just wish there was a way this brand could bring the price down. We would buy them much more often and so would all those who we told to get some. Each one complained about price but all loved the taste.  Would give this a 5 star if closer to $4 than $5

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2019
comment: I bought 2 boxes and they came in the corrugated Amazon box. When I went to try them, they were packed just in thick cellophane in the manufacturer’s box, and they were mostly crumbs! The other box was the same...broken crackers and mostly crumbs. I tried them anyway. The taste is okay, a little salty though. At the same time I ordered Back to Nature Multigrain Seeded Flatbread. That company packed the crackers better in the box. They were no broken and tasted much better.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2018
comment: I was recommended these crackers as a substitute for crackers and other vehicles for dips. I love homemade guacamole, and I was tired of using veggies as my dippers. (I'm on a Paleo-Keto diet) These seed crackers were the perfect solution. This flavor is 'everything,' so think of it as an everything bagel with extra onion. They did the trick! But I would like to try the original next to see the taste difference.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019
comment: I’m ecstatic that Mary went crackers!!  These GLUTEN FREE crackers are full of the best taste ever!! The crackers are thick enough that you can spread them with cheese spreads, peanut or almond butter, etc. For a healthier, tastier snack, you just have to try these. This is about my 5th purchase of these crackers.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2020
comment: These Mary's Gone Crackers Super Seed organic crackers are a perfect accompaniment to soups, chili and salads.  They are great tasting and full of healthy plant protein and seeds, and are made with organic ingredients.  Healthier alternative to chips.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2019
comment: First time these crackers tasted so bad.  Tastes like Pledge smells!  Lemon oil used when a better tasting lemon flavoring should be used.  No dill smell, taste or pieces of dill seen.Original crackers are the best.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2020

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2019

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2018
comment: I’ve tried this and the original seed variety. Read on about my negative experience with both:I have purchased at least ten+ boxes from Sprouts. They had a burnt flavor indicating they were left in the oven too long. I emailed the company to let them know. They said they’d send me coupons and never did. I followed up saying I hadn’t received them and they said sure we’ll send them off. Three weeks later nothing. I found good seed crackers at Trader Joe’s which don’t cost almost $6 a box and without concern of eating burnt crackers. I can’t believe I query in politely to let them know and they led me on, hence my decision to write a review. Seriously, without any exaggeration these are the worst crackers I’ve ever had the displeasure of tasting.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
comment_title: No problem with crushed crackers; but you better LOVE burnt onion
comment: I so wanted to love these. I just don't. No problem like others with crushed cracker delivery; my issue was all about the flavor. Burnt and oppressive onion is not Everything. The regular seed ones are great.

comment_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2018
comment: I broke a tooth, badly, on Marry's Super Seed Crackers.  I called the company and it was impossible to even get through to a representative.  I called three times, having to leave messages.  After three weeks, no one has called me back.  There was some sort of  very hard "seed"  -- which could have been small stone or gravel -- in the seed when I bit down.  I now have to get a crown.  I'll never buy these crackers again.  The company is irresponsible as well, never having the courtesy to call me back.  This is a very lame company with a high-risk product.
